review.reviewBody:
1 - These gloves are easily 2-3 sizes off (too small).  I have small hands. Most of the time I order an XS or S. I ordered a M after reading the other review about these gloves running small and it is still way too small. 
2 - Don't expect Backcountry to help you out in the return process either. You are on your own for shipping it back. Backcountry should not be selling this product with incorrect size charts by 2 sizes, and charging the customer for the returns.

review.reviewBody: Well, seems like everything PI makes is one size too small even according to their size charts. Nice glove but order up one size! No wonder they now make a women's X-Large! Bought the large according to size chart and previous fit of gloves I own. I could barely squeeze my hands into them. Without the velcro( which I think is great) my hands would eventually tear the seams of the glove. Also I like the fact they offer a nice alternative color to gloves than the usually bland black! Recommend sizing up a size-if possible! No X-large left in grey. Had to return them.

review.reviewBody: The design is beautiful. I use these for road cycling but I find myself constantly having to push the glasses back up because they are loose and don't fit well around my nose bridge. I think the fit could have been designed much better.
review.name: Beautiful design, too loose of a fit

review.reviewBody:
These are high quality sunglasses, but they’re much larger and less curved than other Smith cycling  sunglasses.

Smith lists these as a medium fit, but they’re definitely for larger faces.

The’re also far less curved than the other Smith models I have, such as Ruskus, Arena, and Attack. The photo is of the Shift Split vs Ruckus, the difference in size and curve is substantial.

So, recommended, if you have a larger face and don’t want sunglasses with a close to the face wrap.
review.name: Smith Quality, But Only For Larger Faces

review.reviewBody: So, I love the sunglasses, their functionality is absolutely perfect… but, they’re purple and pink. I ordered the ones called “Matte Terra / Poppy” and the pictured showed them as a kind of crimson and orange, but, they’re definitely purple and pink. I’m a guy. Luckily, I’m pretty confident and comfortable and I care about how well they work more than how they look, but they’re totally purple and pink. However, 5 star review because after years of constantly adjusting my helmet and sunglasses while racing in aero drops so I can see, I paired these glasses with the smith ignite helmet and I can see and I never have to adjust! It’s soooo nice! I can put up wearing some odd colors for that. Cheers!
review.name: Purple and pink! Caution!

review.reviewBody: The biggest problem with these, same as some other reviewers have mentioned is that the fit of the glasses are loose and floppy feeling. I am female and just thought my head wasn’t wide enough to accommodate these glasses. However the other reviews are from men saying the same thing. I will try to find a way to Jimmy them so they are tighter on my head and don’t fall down my face.
review.name: Looks great but fit is poor

review.reviewBody: I will reiterate what has been alluded to with other comments here. I am a big dude with a relatively big face and somehow these glasses feel loose and floppy. They look great and have a high-quality lens, but the glasses just aren't secure on my face. They bounce around on the mountain bike and feel like the wind will take them off my face if I were to look back on the road bike. The arms are loose on my temples and the nose piece does not grip so I am constantly pushing them back up on my face. I have always been a fan of Smith products, but these seem to miss the mark.
review.name: I really want to like them..

review.reviewBody: These sunglasses do not curve as much as the Reverb or other models of Smith sunglasses, allowing more air from the sides and bottom of the sunglasses to pass over my eyes. Since I wear corrective lenses this style does not work for me; I need a more curved design that does not allow for as large of gaps at the bottom and sides of the sunglasses. I used them for several long gravel rides and they tended to stay on my face relatively well considering how far away the bottom of the glasses hover from my face, but sweat from my helmet would often run down the front of them. Lastly, the durability and scratch-resistance of the black gold mirror lens was lacking and I found several spots on the glasses where the chrome finish has worn off. The Mag arms for switching from the clear lens to the sunglass lens are very nice and the quality of the glasses is great. There are many other styles I've had success with from Smith but these ones aren't for me.
review.name: These Sunglasses fall flat for a contact user

review.reviewBody: These are great glasses out of the box! Fit is as advertised and coverage is expansive. However, after only owning these for less than 3 months, the lenses are separating from the frame due to the adhesive no longer supporting the weight of the lens. I’ve reached out to smith regarding a warranty claim. I’m unsure if this is an isolated event but Smith Optics has a reputation of taking care of their customers and I’m hoping to have a great experience.
review.name: Jury is Still Out

name: Shift Split MAG ChromaPop Sunglasses

review.reviewBody:
I like the bibs, but I just returned what should be my size and ordered one size up. All sizes seem fine through legs, hips and waist and then the bib part (the part above the waist) is very narrow. It is made of elastic material, but after zipping it up I felt like in a corset, even before putting any layers on. The pictures on the site don't give an indication about that tightness.

review.name: Best ever

review.itemreviewed: Phantom Alpine Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
This jacket is super light and incredibly warm and durable. I get cold easy, and I've tried on and worn plenty of puffies I've been too cold in (including Mountain Hardwear's Ghost Whisperer), but not this one. In the winter I use it as an extra layer snowboarding on single-digit days under an insulated shell. It's thin enough that it doesn't restrict movement and just adds warmth. This summer I've been using it on alpine climbs in the Colorado mountains, where I've largely been in the shade and temps have been in the 40s. It's kept me warm, and it's not at all restrictive. I've comfortably climbed multi-pitches while wearing it. Frankly, I can't believe how tough the fabric is. It doesn't look like it's tough, but I've only ended up with 1 hole this summer when I thought for sure I would have at least 10. I've spent plenty of time dragging it against sharp rocks. I've also stuffed in my pack with cams and other climbing gear, and it's come out just fine every time. On top of that it's ultralight and, like any down jacket, packs down nice and small. 
All that said, I don't think I'd wear it as a standalone puffy in the winter. It's probably not warm enough for that.  But it excels as a warm layer when you need to be able to move freely and travel light. 
I have a small chest and don't have the tassel problem other people have complained about, and personally, I love the higher, harness-compatible pockets. I'm 5'8" and 125 lbs and have the XS, which easily fits over other layers (including a Kor Nimbus Hoody in size S, which was oddly the size I needed in that jacket instead of XS). The arms are also plenty long in the XS. I also love the beautiful blue color ("traverse").
review.name: Technical puffy that's perfect for the alpine

name: Phantom Alpine Down Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Broad Peak IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I previously had the top recommended Wirecutter jacket that my dog ripped hole in after several years of use and wanted to give another jacket a try.

This one exceeded my expectations in that the hood covers large portion of my face when fully zipped. That has helped me a lot on windy days to minimize heat loss. I'm someone who's always cold and was at first skeptical of warmth rating since the billows are more compact than my previous jacket. But it's been great! 

The manufacturing is excellent from what I can tell. The one thing I've noticed is the zipper setup seems reverse of what I normally see for male jackets in the US. I suspect it's because Mammut is European company but not sure. Overall, fantastic product!
review.name: Warm, compact, and my new go-to jacket

name: Broad Peak IN Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I use em for resort and touring fairly heavily. Held up well even with some rocks/scrambling thrown into the mix, haven't got wet even in storms or when sitting, climbing in snow, etc. Breathability is enough that if you regulate your output on the uptrack you won't get wet with sweat, which is really all I can ask for. Pretty happy w/ these love the lower pocket which can be used for a beacon
review.name: Pretty good insulated pants

review.reviewBody: Sizing was an issue. Had a previous pair that was a medium size. This pant medium was a lot smaller and would not fit. Had to move up to a large to get them to fit.
review.name: size may be an issue

review.reviewBody: I have been using OR clothing for years now with no reservations regarding quality or longevity. I previously had a pair of OR Igneo ski pants that lasted for ever and I eventually had to dispose of them when I had worn holes in the pocket and crotch. It was getting ridiculous sewing them back together. As an outdoor professional I really drive my gear until it dies and I wore the Igneos for hundreds of days heli-skiing and ski touring... The Tungsten II pants seemed to be the closest thing to replace them with. No regrets there. PRO: I LOVE the fact that they come in three different lengths. The short length was exactly what I was looking for. I hate pants that are way too long for me. CON: I would have given these pants 5 stars except for the fact that I found the waist size a bit deceiving. My old Igneos were a large and fit extremely well. So, I bought large in the Tungsten IIs. They were just a bit too snug in the waist for adding that extra layer for the frigid days we recently had in the Canadian Rockies (Yes, minus 40 is a thing.) I kept the large size and ended up buying two additional pairs of XL for the colder days as well. I have never worn a size XL in my life. (and Yes, I like them that much that I now own three pairs.) The XLs are a bit baggy in the legs for me but I can wear my expedition weight base layers for the frigid days and for when I am standing around instructing in the cold or digging snow profiles.
review.name: Great Pants but...!

name: Tungsten II Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought this month ago and have found this shoe to be one of the most comfortable aggressive shoes that I've own. I have a wider foot and this shoe doesn't pinch cram my toes together like some of the other shoes out there. Do down size though! The shoe really did stretch after a couple wears and I was glad I listened the other reviewers. I normally wear 7.5 W and downsized to 7W.
review.name: Super Comfortable, almost perfect

review.reviewBody: Granted I am not an expert, but I have wide feet and can be very picky. These shoes are perfect! Super sticky, wide box, and great for small foot holds.  I wear a size 12 mens shoe, and was worried that 10.5 would be waay too tight. Well, they are tight, but they stretched and I am very pleased.
review.name: Took a chance, no regrets

review.reviewBody:
I'm an intermediate climber and was looking for aggressive shoes that weren't painful to wear. I have wide feet (in the ballpark of 3E-4E), and could really only fit in wide shoes like the Skwama (painful heel), Instinct (too high volume), Shaman (painful toe) and the Mastia. The toe cap rubber is flexible enough to relieve pressure on your toe knuckles and is functional. I'd say the shoe has moderate sensitivity - it's definitely more sensitive than XS Edge shoes, but not quite as sensitive as other slippers I tried on. The shoe is pretty flexible, and (so far) the shape holds and is tensioned enough to help you drive power through the toes (as someone new to aggressive shoes, I can definitely feel it working, and my feet need a break). It's been very versatile in the gym; I haven't gotten a chance to take it outside yet. Not sure why they use XS Grip instead of XS Grip 2, but the rubber doesn't seem as confidence-inspiring compared to other shoes I've tried. At any rate, I'd definitely buy it again, assuming that it's durable in the long run. As far as performance and comfort, it's a winner for me.

For sizing, I followed Tenaya's suggestion (they have a sizing tool on their website). It recommended 1.5 (US mens) sizes down from street for a "comfort" fit, which is what I got. I generally wear my street shoes on the tighter end with not much room past the toes. The "comfort" fit is snug throughout the foot, but has a little slop in the heel (I have a narrow heel). Just to test the limits, I've cranked a heel hook with my full body weight, and my heel does slide around (I do have a narrow heels), but did not pop or dislodge the shoe. I can generally wear the shoe for ~20-30 mins at a time before needing a quick break, to relieve my foot from the tension in the curved shape. IMO this is perfect for any casual climber as my climbing rarely requires that intense of a heel hook. I do wish that 

If you're looking for performance, I'd go 2 sizes down, and if you're one who likes squeezing your foot for every last drop of performance, I'd go 2.5 sizes down. If you wear your street shoes with a lot of room past the toes, I'd go down half a size further. YMMV as everyone's feet are different.
review.name: Comfy, Wide, Aggressive

review.reviewBody:
I have tried 3 other Tenaya climbing shoes and the Mastia is by far my favorite! I pretty much only used it in the gym so I don't know how well it fares outdoors, but I found it very versatile in the gym setting.  I definitely would buy it again (:  

FYI - the chart that is shown is US men's, click on the full-size chart to see women's/EU sizes... I got confused initially since there was no label on the chart.
review.name: Favorite Tenaya Shoe

review.reviewBody:
This is a review on sizing only, as these run shockingly large. 

My street shoe size is 11, and I wear Tenaya Ra in size 10.5 with a form-fitting, snug/comfortable fit. 

The Mastia at the same size as the Ra is downright loose. I could slip my foot out while strapped, and I didn’t even have a chance to climb in them. 

I know climbing shoe sizing is all over the place, but the gap between the fit of these and the Ra is baffling.
review.name: Size Down!

review.reviewBody:
This was my go-to shoe for about a year for bouldering and some sport climbing. The shoe has a nice fitting heel for my foot compared to the Oasi and the Iati models, and the heel design is similar to the Skwamas for stability. It also is stiff rubber, but softens over time.

That being said, my experience with other Tenaya models can be said for this one as well. For reference, I’m a street 8.5 M, and I have to get these 5.5-6 M, same with other Tenaya models. These shoes will probably last you for a good 3-6 months before they start to become floppy and the rubber begins to fall apart. It doesn’t really help that they can be pricey too. However, these are pretty great shoes for the time you have them.

Other models I’ve owned:

Five Ten Hiangle Men’s- 7.5 US M
La Sportiva Mantra- 6 U.S M
review.name: Great shoe for Wide Feet

review.reviewBody: I'm a mens size 7.5 in Evolv (shamans and oracles), I orded the 7.5 Mastia - I will say if you have a narrow foot this isn't the shoe for you. I'm bummed because I like the way they look a lot and I've heard amazing things.
review.name: Small Foot Review

review.reviewBody:
This shoe strikes a great balance of sensitivity and power. The mid sole is rather soft, but the toe box and edge is stiff enough to transfer power even on small holds. The shape of the toe box aids in precision, and the heel fits and sticks well across a wide range of holds. For an aggressive shoe, it is immensely comfortable. 

As for sizing, this shoe runs large compared to other Tenaya models. I'd recommend going down a half size from what you wear in the Iati/Oasi/Mundaka. 

Sizing compared to other brands:
Mastia Size purchased 41.5 (41 would be performance fit)
Tenaya: Mundaka 41.5
Lasportiva: Skwama/Genius 41.5, Solution/Solution Comp 42
Madrock: Drone HV 11 M
Evolv: Oracle 10.5 M
5.10: Hiangle 10.5M
review.name: Confidence Inspiring!

name: Mastia Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased the North Face Router Backpack in grey, and I am absolutely in love with it. This backpack is a game-changer for anyone who needs both style and functionality. First, the design is sleek and modern, with a neutral grey color that goes well with any outfit or occasion. It's subtle but still has a premium look, which I really appreciate. The quality of the material is top-notch, offering durability without being too bulky or heavy. The storage capacity is impressive. It has multiple compartments, including a dedicated laptop sleeve that fits my 15-inch laptop perfectly. There's plenty of space for books, a water bottle, chargers, and even a jacket. I also love the easy-access front pocket for smaller items like keys, headphones, and my phone. The straps are comfortable and padded, making it easy to carry even when it's fully packed. The back panel is breathable, which helps reduce sweating on those warmer days, and the overall weight distribution feels balanced. Whether you're using it for work, school, or travel, the North Face Router Backpack is practical, stylish, and incredibly well-designed. Highly recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable, versatile backpack!
review.name: Perfect Backpack for Travel and Everyday Use

review.reviewBody: I recently got the North Face Router Backpack in black, and I am beyond impressed. This backpack has everything I was looking for: durability, style, and practical design. The all-black color is sleek and versatile, making it easy to match with any outfit, whether you're heading to work, school, or traveling. The materials are high-quality, and the build feels sturdy without being overly bulky. Storage-wise, this backpack has it all. It features a dedicated laptop sleeve that comfortably fits my 15-inch laptop, along with plenty of room for books, folders, a water bottle, and other essentials. The front pocket provides easy access to smaller items like keys, chargers, and my phone, which is a nice touch. Comfort is another standout feature. The padded straps are very comfortable and adjustable, and the back panel is designed for breathability, so it's comfortable even when carrying it for extended periods. The weight distribution is well-balanced, making it easy to carry even when fully loaded. Overall, the North Face Router Backpack in black is an exceptional, well-thought-out product. Whether you need it for daily commuting or as a travel companion, it's a fantastic choice. Highly recommend it!
review.name: The Perfect Everyday Backpack

review.reviewBody: I bought this backpack for my son, who is a college freshman. His laptop (16.5) fits nicely and remains well protected. Extremely roomy backpack that has enough capacity to accommodate a weekend's worth of clothes (maybe more) if traveling. Backpack appears to be well made; I am hoping it will last a long time.

review.reviewBody:
I finally shredded the sole on my purple and grey Scarpa Helix's that were 3+ years old after heavy use on local sport and trad crags. I love the Helix shoe so much I will be getting the old ones re-soled, but bought the new orange model on sale to see if there were any changes. The shoe has stayed true in comfort and shape with a few upgrades that make it even better.

The comfort level of these shoes has no competition when you're spending a day on the rock. The fit is snug but my toes only feel slightly cramped after an hour or two of constant wear. Scarpa is great for those with narrow heels; no slippage or stretch occurs at the heel cup. Despite a full leather shoe, there is little to no break in and they do not stretch much. Buy them true to size. The lacing system allows for adjusting as needed.

I did notice the toe on the new shoe is slightly more pointed to allow for better contact on smeary foot-holds. The previous model was a pretty rounded toe with less stick on tougher climbs. I also love the oversized heel loops that help pull them on and a wider, more comfortable tongue. The stitching on the new model seems more reinforced throughout and the rubber now has a denser platform on the ball of the foot and heel. This makes them a little stiffer but more supportive and dependable overall. 

Highly recommended essential shoe for roped climbs, but not agressive enough for bouldering or highly technical climbs.
review.name: Favorite Outdoor Climbing Shoe for Years

review.reviewBody: compares well to Marmot Gore-Tex and Patagonia top products I’ve owned in the past …Not sure why they limited the amount of pockets. Could’ve used another sleeve pocket and maybe one porch chest pocket for the cost I would expect.
review.name: Nice jacket…

review.itemreviewed: Eiger Free Advanced HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Be careful when ordering multiple items through this site. Despite your careful packaging and even if you follow their requested returns process, they may lose hundreds (or thousands) of dollars of your money along the way. 

Never had an issue with Moosejaw. Don’t like what Moosejaw has in stock; but at least they don’t lose items and make me pay $600+ dollars for something I didn’t keep.

Yeah, yeah, this doesn’t have anything to do with the item. But figured I’d let you know.

My review of the item: a bit too small in some places, too bulky in others. Too short. Might fit someone else, but be careful if you plan on trying on and then returning given what I said above.
review.name: Backcountry lost my return.

name: Eiger Free Advanced HS Hooded Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Trail Lite Sleeping Bag: 20F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Loved the color and design. Had to return because it just wouldn't fit my 6'1/250 lb frame comfortably.
review.name: Nice Bag; Just Too Small For Me

review.reviewBody: I used this in sub 30 degree weather and it kept me so warm!
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody: Nice quality sleeping bag but did not like the way the zipper only goes down half way.  Not only it makes it harder to get in but if I wanted to use the sleeping bag as a blanket when the weather isn't so cold, I won't be able to open it up all the way.
review.name: Zipper only goes down halfway from top

review.reviewBody: Got this to replace an older lesser rated NF Furnace and I'm glad I did! This kept me toasty warm in the high alpine in northern BC on a very chilly night!
review.name: Exceptional bag!

review.reviewBody: Ppl are confused about the bags. The larger mesh bag is for storage at home because you dont want down packed tightly constantly. It comes with a smaller bag to pack when you actually camp. It's super comfortable from 0degrees c to 15 deg c. Not sure about below 0.
review.name: Love this bag

review.reviewBody: I have only used this bag car camping in Colorado so far. But it is super warm, comfy, and compacts well. I assume it will be great for when I finally get to go backpacking!
review.name: I would definitely buy again!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The sleeping bag comes with 2 (TWO) bags to store it in. One if you feel lazy and just stuff it inside and the other small one to have stored nicely in a backpack. The review above from another person above is not correct about it not coming with a small bag. The smaller bag is inside the sleeping bag, attached and removable. Really like the color and how light and breathable to material feels, my boys love it and can't wait to use it camping!!!
review.name: Great !!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased this down bag for the backpacking the High Sierra's. Took it on an overnight on the Tahoe Rim Trail recently and it was wonderful. Kept me warm in 30 degree weather and is super lightweight.
review.name: Terrific light weight down bag.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The bag has a strong odor -smells like a wet dog or wet chicken -likely because the feather/down fill has been treated and recycled. No virgin goose down fill in it. The seems of the tubes on the bottom of the bag are sewn through - probably because not much fill loft is needed on the bottom part of the bag. Zipper length is 2/3 of the length of the bag - no ventilation at the foot section is possible if desired, or using the bag as a blanket is not practical. I would look for other options at the price point of this bag.
review.name: Very unlikely that I would buy this bag again.

review.reviewBody: Product was very comfortable and light weight. Great for backpacking! Unfortunately the temperature rating isnt quite accurate. Was rather cold overnight @ +5°.
review.name: Very comfy, and lightweight. Questionable temperature rating

name: Trail Lite Sleeping Bag: 20F Down

review.reviewBody: Got for my daughter but I wear it everyday   Thick. Lightweight and hardworking jacket. No rain or snow goes through it. Stiff collar but with scarf it is the best.
review.name: Best lightweight jacket

review.reviewBody:
I had so many questions about this jacket when buying online and not having the opportunity to try it on first. The first question was sizing bc I read reviews saying it was too big.  I bought based on the actual measurements of the jacket. I have a medium that is 22" in the chest. I usually wear L or XL in women's clothes,  I'm happy w this choice bc the jacket is a little more fitted which is good given the weight and bulk. 
The other thing I wondered was whether it stretches. People said it was stiff, and it is. I'm assuming it might loosen up w wear over time.  There is some stretch in the jacket and it is the perfect amount to wear this jacket more fitted.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Yes, this was expensive but when I got it, I couldn't believe how well constructed it was.  The fit was perfect and contoured.  It was lined and the fleece was dense, with heavy duty zippers.  It's so stylish I almost don't want to wear it for everyday.
review.name: Excellent Craftsmanship

review.reviewBody: I’m 5’1” and originally ordered XS but that was too big so exchanged for XXS and the smaller size fits great. Its very warm and comfortable. Good sized pockets. I’m able to wear multiple layers underneath. The white color is prone to getting dirty, but can remove easily if cleaned right away
review.name: Love this jacket

review.reviewBody: Super cozy fleece. The inner lining is really silky so easy to layer underneath.
review.name: Cozy!

description: Buy the SRAM PF30 Bottom Bracket online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: PF30 Bottom Bracket
hasVariant.description: Buy the SRAM PF30 Bottom Bracket online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've gone through 2 of these in the last year. Some gunk got into the bearings of the first BB and the second began creaking after 3 months. Both were great initially low friction and quiet but both failed in my opinion. Both were installed correctly, no grease, correct BB tool. It's inexpensive and works but for the third one I opted for a threaded BB and couldn't be happier.
review.name: Strike two! Go threaded for the homer
comment:
Hi Erik,

Thank you for taking the time to leave this review. Creaking can be a common issue or develop more frequently if you are riding in wet or muddy conditions regularly. Additionally, if you ride very frequently you may replace these more often as well. That said a thread-through style BB may be a better fit. If you need any help selecting the right bottom bracket for your bike you can always call a gearhead. We are happy to help.

Best,

Hannah

name: PF30 Bottom Bracket

review.reviewBody: Love the product; hate the fit.  Ordered 2XL and cut the sleeves and neck because too tight.  Regardless, product works very well.  FWIW, my chest measures 43-44 in.
review.name: Castelli - good product, poor fit

review.reviewBody: Like many other reviews, it fits "tight".  I'm 6'1" and normally my chest is around 42" around measured under arms to provide context.  A L/XL does fit and surprisingly feels good. I particularly like the long length to get down in bibs.  I now had a full summer and full winter on it.  it's AWESOME for summer, must have and I can only imagine in warmer climates it even more so.  I'm in Pacific NW.  For Winter, not so much, it doesn't replace a merino base layer for comfort or air insulation.  I have washed mine around 40 to 50 times on delicate with kit, but also used delicate low heat drying in tumble dryer and it's going strong.  Even still "white".  If I had a complaint, I'd like it in long sleeves and a dark color.  It's under the jersey so color for light shouldn't matter, and I'm not fond of "white".  I'd say for friends in the warmer states, southern U.S. with humidity and temperature, this is a MUST HAVE.  Good luck, and as always backcountry gearheads were awesome to work with.
review.name: Castelli mesh undergarment

review.reviewBody:
I bought this and the Craft Mesh Superlight to compare.  Two things: 
(1) This is open mesh, like a net, unlike the Craft and other "mesh" base layers I have. I bought this, in part, for indoor riding on the trainer, and, while it's light, not sure it'll stop the sweat from pouring off, due to the holes.
(2) As others have written, it runs even smaller than other Castelli gear.  I have around a 37" chest, and the S/M is tight.  Castelli's race jersey in S is snug on me, so I usually wear a M, but this S/M is even tighter than the S race jersey.  In comparison, the Craft in S fits me quite well.
To be clear, I have not tried it out yet, so these are just initial impressions out of the box.
review.name: Open mesh; runs VERY small

name: Core Mesh 3 Sleeveless Baselayer - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I ran into the same issue other people mentioned here with the end caps.  What I found though is if you have your bars sticking out an 1/8"+/- beyond the rubber grip on the bottom, then the clamp will have something to bite into and I think they are going to stay put.  

I don't like squishy grips and I like how these feel a lot.  Feels like I have more control when riding.
review.name: End Caps Are Tricky

review.reviewBody: Dangit, I loved these grips initially. Just the right size (33) and I thought having a lock ring on both ends was a great design. But one of mine already fell off after a few weeks. I thought it was just me but when I searched the issue I landed on this review page. Ugh. Nice grips, just please fix the lock ring design.
review.name: +1 for Lock Ring Falling Off

review.reviewBody: I picked the color because it was nearest the accent color for my 2019 Ibis Ripmo. This grip was easy to install and has a solid feel. I find it much better than the grip that came with the bike, which after less than a year were falling apart.
review.name: Great grip & looks good too

review.reviewBody: The grips feel and look great. The larger diameter (33mm) is much more comfortable compared to what I had before. As an FYI my hands arent the biggest. Im not a fan of having a clamp on both ends of the grip but other than that they are good. I havent had the problem other reviewers have had with the end cap falling off.
review.name: Good grips, not a fan of two clamps

review.reviewBody: they are beautiful but the fact that the end caps do not stay on is ridiculous. dont waste your time or money.
review.name: dont bother
comment: I initially had a similar problem. Make sure the plastic end tabs on the grip is flush with the ends of your bars. This enables the lock ring something to purchase, if you just tighten them into the grip and not the bar they will never stay on.

review.reviewBody:
Got the 33mm grips, super sticky and feel great in my hand (im 6'1, 170lb, long skinny hands). 
This should be a 5 star review but the stupid left grip end cap fell off. It doesn't change how solid the grips feels but i cant even look at my bike from the left side now!

Took my bike by a shop for some work, shop owner said the reason the end caps fall off is if they aren't fully jammed on to the bar... that's all well and good but this wasn't my first grip swap (yes i hit the grip with my palm before tightening) and the grip only has 1 screw at the thumb, not on the end cap.

Just to test, i moved the right grip out and did the same ride i lost the left on... right end cap is still there. not really sure what the deal is, maybe i knocked it lose?

Will order another set, just annoying.
review.name: Love these, but stupid cap fell off
comment: I initially had a similar problem. Make sure the plastic end tabs on the grip is flush with the ends of your bars. This enables the lock ring something to purchase, if you just tighten them into the grip and not the bar they will never stay on.

name: Grippler Lock-On Grips

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These do fit big. I'm normally a 7, but wish I ordered a 6.5 as that would have fit better. I did have to get an insole as the sole cushioning isn't really great for hikers. They are great shoes despite all that. The tread is great on all terrain.
review.name: Great shoe, downsize for best fit

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great comfortable and light weight grateful for long walk or standing for long time
review.name: Nice shoes

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and it’s not what I expected. Great to walk on uneven ground, pebbled surface and even on climbing rocks.
review.name: Right decision

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Highly recommend . Also appreciate the fact my feet don’t sweat as much as other hikers
review.name: Just what I was looking for. Comfort hiking.

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 Low Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.name: Waterproof, worth every penny, and stylish.

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Great cushion and good material. Comfortable shoes and seems breathable. I purchased for the Gore-tex, hoping to wear them for rainy days while travelling. 
I have narrow feet and usually wear a size 8 running shoe with insoles. I bought the 7.5 seeing some reviews to size down, but now wish I had sized down by a full size. Unfortunately, they are a return for me since the 7 is sold out.
review.name: Runs large

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: very comfortable to wear and the soul was too good.
review.name: best product ever

review.reviewBody: These are very cute and durable enough for outdoor activities, but also nice to wear in general. Pockets are a nice size, although at least one zippered one would be nice. My only gripe is that the belt isn’t detachable and that the waist is kinda puffy—it puffs out when I’m sitting which is a bit weird. But overall I still wear them a lot. I enjoyrolling them up at the ankles. The legs are also slightly short, but that’s the style I like.
review.name: Good pants

review.reviewBody: Im obsessed. The fabric is soft. Wear them everywhere. I have a size small and I'm 5'2 140lbs and theres enough room in the waist for me to be comfortable. I love that they're not too tight.
review.name: Fav pants

review.reviewBody: I am usually a medium/ large and I ordered the medium and need to return to get the small- also you have to pay for returns from this site so I recommend sizing down! (I usually size up because I like things big but it wouldn't even stay up)
review.name: RUN LARGE

review.reviewBody: After three years of only comfortable clothes, all sweats and no trousers, I took a chance on the Stoic Venture Pant. I need all purpose clothes to wear all day, at a desk, on a trail, in a boat, on a rocky shore, or in a grocery store. These pants are comfy enough for sitting, sturdy enough for mountains, and flexible enough for trails. I first bought size Small and I have to roll the waist, so I tried XS, and they are perfect. Love the gently tapered ankles. I’m happy and I’m wearing real pants!
review.name: Real Pants!

review.reviewBody: Ordered a size small in green moss. I'm 5'0 120lb with short torso and long legs. The pants are slightly higher waisted than I was expecting but I've grown to not mind it. Length of legs fits fine rolled a couple times. 4/5 stars just because the button has loose strands and seems like it will come off soon, but it's easily fixed so I'm keeping the pants. I've worn them every day since they arrived and they are incredibly comfortable! They hold their shape well but are also super stretchy, I can do anything in these. The green color is lovely and matches most of my wardrobe. I've gotten many complements on them already.
review.name: I've worn them four days in a row...

review.reviewBody: These pants fit well and I am happy to have them (5'3", 145 lbs, 33-28-40 ordered size medium), but I got the same men's version for my boyfriend and now I am disappointed! The men's version has a crotch gusset, much deeper front pockets and velcro closures on the back pockets. What the heck?! I am using these for field work and will be doing all the same activities as men. Why is their version crafted for greater range of motion and more pocket use than the women's? I am tempted to order a men's pair in a smaller size for myself.
review.name: But why do the men's version have more?!

review.reviewBody: I've been looking for the right pants this style for a long time and these are it. They're stretchy, comfy, and just the right length (I'm 6ft so they might not be the right length for everyone, but they look great cuffed at the bottom). The material feels good, durable, and the silhouette is just what I wanted - fitted around the waist, straight through the hips, and tapered at the bottom.
review.name: Amazing pants

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to love these pants, but I returned before using because they were too small. I am usually a size 4 and the smalls were just too tight around the waist and the waist is not stretchy.
review.name: Too Small

name: Venture Pant - Past Season - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Altra Escalante 4 Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I had my last pair for three years. They are a perfect gym shoe and a nice dark black. Unfortunately, my new dog ate them. My new ones arrived today and are not remotely black. They are navy/gray color as someone else described. The picture on the website definitely shows a true black. I already have a gray Altra and I'm bummed that my go to gym and work shoe is no longer going to match with all of my black clothing. I highly recommend advertising it as the color it is, or even better, pretty please bring back the nice dark black version! The shoe itself still looks and fits great. I guess time will tell if the sole peels back as others have mentioned.
review.name: Perfect, except NOT black

review.reviewBody: I use this shoe for running mainly and love the wider toe box. It's a comfortable fit. The stack is not too high at 24 mm - I also have the escalante racer which has a 22mm stack. I am trying to progress down to minimalist shoes so the escalante 4 are a good step in that transition. I would like to see more choices from Altra with a low cushioning/ stack especially in their trail shoes. But I love that they stay loyal to the wider toe box and zero drop
review.name: Wide toe box and zero drop are a big attraction

review.reviewBody: I am pretty happy with these sneaker. Thanks to whoever came up with the concept.
review.name: Love em

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these shoes. I bought one pair around the beginning of June and loved them so much that I bought another pair a month or so later. They are awesome to walk in and wear on a daily basis. They are so comfortable right out of the box. The only complaint I have is that the first pair I bought now have holes in the back of the heels so they now hurt my heel when I wear them. They are only 3 months old! It's unfortunate to pay that much for a pair of shoes for them to only last 3 months.
review.name: Great shoe only one complaint

review.reviewBody: I really love these shoes and they have actually been really great for my shin splints and back. However, a section of the sole is peeling off after only about a month and a half of wear possibly even less than that. I don't really wear them that much since it's summer and I've been in mostly sandals, but I've been wearing them to the gym about four times a week. They peeled off after less than 25 days of wearing them which I've never had to happen with any other shoes. However, I continue wearing them because they have been the best shoes for my back and shins. I just wish the sole was better quality.
review.name: I love the shoes but sole is falling apart after only 1.5 mo

review.reviewBody: I walk 7 miles a day and always would wear On Cloud X because they are the only ones that didn't hurt my feet. I have tried Hoka, Nike, On, ASICS, Reebok to name a few and since On changed their Cloud X they hurt too. I love these - they are comfortable and don't hurt at all.
review.name: Love these sneakers

review.reviewBody: The shoe feels great but looks terrible because it's a navy/gray color when it's advertised as black! Thought I had found the perfect shoe until these arrived. Escalante meets all my criteria (zero drop, natural wide toe box, normal amount of cushion like a "regular" shoe) but I ordered and desired a BLACK shoe. These shoes match none of my clothing and are a huge disappointment. Hoping Altra exchanges them for something that meets my needs but I don't see any other styles in black that don't have an excessive amount of cushion. I really wish this model ACTUALLY came in black. It would be so easy for them to make this a black shoe like the one in the picture but alas... If style is important to you, don't order this shoe. It looks nothing like the shoe in the picture on the site.
review.name: BEWARE, NOT BLACK

review.reviewBody: The fit Perfect and so comfortable now I just need a discount code for the next pair
review.name: Going to buy another pair

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable shoe but it does feel a touch too narrow how it's advertised. There is also already damage to same place on the tongue of both shoes in the right corner. I want to like them!
review.name: Not as expected but hopeful they'll work out the kinks

review.reviewBody: These are my new favorite work shoes! I am a nurse who works in a fast paced unit at a hospital for 12 hour shifts, let me tell you my feet don't hurt after. I've been searching for years for a shoe to help with my tired aching legs and feet. What makes these good for me is the slight negative heel drop , wide toe box and lower profile. I have tried many other expensive brands, some literally feel like I'm walking in wet sand because of the incredibly high profile and cushion. I wear mostly barefoot type shoes at home but I found I needed a little cushion at work due to concrete floors. Thanks for making a shoe that seems to be made for me! I will definitely repurchase.
review.name: Fabulous shoes seemingly made just for me!!

name: Escalante 4 Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: These women's Dawnstrike pants I ordered in the short leg length for my fiancee, who is only about 5' tall. In addition to recently ordering these pants for my fiancee, over the past decade I have ordered 3 of these pants, men's version, for myself. (The first one finally got a bit raggedy from use and abuse, so I ordered another to replace them, and more recently I lost weight and ordered the next size down.) These same pants used to be called the "Powder Flo," and for some reason The North Face stopped making them for a couple seasons, so I'm glad they're now back as the "Dawnstrike." Simply put, these are the best ski pants on the planet. The durability of the outer layer material, the Gore-Tex membrane, and the large and perfectly placed zippered pockets for everything I normally carry on the slopes is a must for me. It doesn't make sense to me why most ski pants these days skimp on the pockets, except I guess some people find it's a more attractive streamlined look, which is really quite foolish considering the benefit most skiers get from having the storage space of 4 reasonably large front-accessible pockets. Of course all of this wouldn't mean much if these ski pants didn't fit well, and I can say they fit exceptionally well. Aside from their overall design and construction, the huge benefit with these ski pants are that they are available in 3 different leg lengths. Why aren't the vast majority of other ski clothing manufacturers doing this? Probably because they assume the consumer to be ignorant and overlook that, I guess. But for me, as I have shorter legs, it's a huge deal! It was annoying when I used to find myself stepping on the back of the lower cuff of the ski pants I used to have before I discovered these one's from The North Face. My only wish is that The North Face offered these pants in one or two insulated versions, because they're more of a shell, although the 3 layers do add some amount of insulating value.
review.name: The best Ski Pants on the Planet!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] One fall and a large tear that NF says is unrepairable. They didn't last one season and they were trash. Aside from that the waist was too big and it lacks belt loops to do anything about it.
review.name: Certainly not durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The pants are very thin on the outer layer, and very easily tear. I've worn these one season, and there's already holes in the pants. Do not recommend this pet. I was so excited that Northface finally came out with a Gore-Tex pant, I am so disappointed. I've had Gore-Tex pants before, and never had this issue. They make it so hard to get it approved by warranty, you have to spend money to send it there, and then they may or may not fix it. For how expensive these pants are, I am so Sadly, disappointed.
review.name: I would not buy this product again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] True to size, incredibly warm and waterproof for the slopes
review.name: Great Ski Pant

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought these specifically because they were made of gore-tex, however the fabric isn't waterproof and wears easily. They also restrict movement. Zipper pockets broke after a few uses.
review.name: Not what I was expecting

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the fit and feel
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The material feels extremely cheap. Only worn for 3 months and already has a rip. I can't justify spending the money if the product won't last. Recommend if worn to commute in cold weather.
review.name: Material feels cheap

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really wanted to like these. Based on the size guide I first ordered an xxl. (I'm a 16) They were huge. I returned those and just tried on the xl: these fit more like a L. I compared them to my freedom insulated snow pants that I also have in an xl and they are an inch smaller than those. Bummer, I really wanted to like them.
review.name: Not for the curvier of us

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these because it gets so darn cold where I live. WOW these would have been amazing if I would've gotten the right size for myself. Amazing customer service!! So easy to return! Free shipping on returns as well!
review.name: Wow the warmth and weather protection!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These pants are amazing! Incredibly versatile and well made definitely would keep ya warm and dry!!! I live in Minnesota where it can get below 40windchill. They were just huge! Customer service was fantastic! Free shipping for returns!
review.name: I'd buy these again!!

name: Dawnstrike GTX Insulated Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I bought this tent a several years back and it worked great initially and then I took it out on a backpack hike and got caught in rain, tent leaked horrendously, luckily there was a shelter on the trail that I was able to use. Tent works great and is fairly light but only good for good weather. By the time I went to try and replace it was already out of warranty. 

I came on to see if MSR offered a new rainfly as an option to purchase as a replacement. Alas, it doesn't seem like they do. Over-all would not recommend.
review.name: Rainfly Disintegrates

review.reviewBody: We have two of these we have had them for 4-5 years. Rain flys failed after the first year. Got caught in a pop shower this weekend and it just rained in our tents. Only good for dry weather camping. Would not recommend.
review.name: Rain fly

review.reviewBody: We have this tent for about 5 years. We take good care of it, but like other reviews stay the rain fly quality is no good. Seems are flaking and rainfly is no longer waterproof. I would not recommend this product
review.name: rainfly leaks

review.reviewBody: My wife and I purchased this tent a few years ago and it worked well the first year or two but afterwards, whenever it rained, significant amounts of condensation and water started infiltrating the tent, we tried waterproofing again with Nikwax spray and attaching the rainfly differently to give it more space but it just does not work properly. This is very disappointing and frustrating as we use the tent once or twice per year only. We also got our sleeping bags and gear wet on several occasions, which can quickly ruin a trip. Otherwise the tent is very spacious and easy to assemble.
review.name: Rainfly not Waterproof

review.reviewBody: We are so disappointed. We were told it was a spacious tent for 3 people. We are only two and wandering where the third one could sleep. We had no space for anything else but our sleeping bags. We opted for this model thinking we could lodge our day pack….
review.name: Too small

review.reviewBody: I love the design. I have the Elixir 1 and use that when I bikepack Very spacious for a 3 person backpacking tent. I'm pretty sure the people who are commenting about the lack of waterproof may be referring to the morning dew/ condensation of moisture that builds up on the inside of the tent in the early morning. One the best tent companies out here.
review.name: My favorite company for tents

review.reviewBody: Very spacious for a 3 person backpacking tent. Nice cruved pole design that keeps the tent low to the ground in the wind.
review.name: Spacious!

review.reviewBody: I have the MSR Elixir 3 for about two years and the rainfly has completely degraded and has now deemed my tent unusable. I loved this tent and it worked so good but for the money I spent it didn’t last.
review.name: Rainfly degrades

review.reviewBody: I have the Elixir 3 tent and love the design of the tent. It is easy to assemble and the doors are large and the zippers are high quality. It withstands high wind extremely well. I'd give it 4 or 5 stars for that, but unfortunately the waterproofing on the fly is poor. After only 4 years the seam tape has completely degraded and the fabric is no longer waterproof. I always take great care of my camping gear and pack it clean and dry. I switched to the MSR Elixir 3 to have a bigger tent for all my gear since I only camp from my vehicle. Trying to decide whether to try a re-waterproof the fly or get a new tent.
review.name: Fly failure

review.reviewBody: Tent is great , good layout, zippers etc but the rain fly material was awful , it peeled away on our second use, and we got completely wet. Clear material defect. Contacted MSR twice ( email and pictures) was auto replied that MSR would be follow up it’s been over a year and nothing. Tent is unfortunately useless now without a rain fly.
review.name: When it rains it’s poor

name: Elixir Tent: 3-Person 3 Season

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable! Separate bags system is great for different temps.
review.name: Great combo bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I just purchased the North Face Dolomite Duo. And have been looking at the different combinations. I'm wondering why I couldn't just zip the Blue layer to the Yellow layer. Then when the temperature is 50* or higher we would use it with the Blue side up, sleeping on the Yellow side. But when the temperature would be down in the 30's. we could just sleep with the yellow side up and the blue side down. This system would not need the bottom side and would save space for camping or back packing. Is there any reason why this couldn't be done with the same relative results as is shown using the bottom layer?
review.name: yes

review.reviewBody: Took this out for a festival and was so, so comfortable! Downside was finding a massive hole inside down near my feet. Unsure if hole was there prior to using or if it tore when I crawled in, but I was bummed out. Have exchanged for a new one and hope it's just a one-off. I'm 157cm with tiny feet, but can say I was snug as a bug in a rug. Not too hot, not too cold, warmed up quickly and didn't need a second blanket on top.
review.name: Hoping the second one lasts!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable when fully assembled. Only the yellow layer has a draft tube that covers the zippers. No protection from the zippers when you only use the blue layer.
review.name: Nice sleeping bag but....

review.reviewBody: eeeeeekkk!!!  high desert oregon 4/17/21....25ish degrees.  thought i might be chilly but did not expect to be SO COLD.  even w/wool socks on, fully clothed, hat, scarf and the works, this bag did not step up to the 15 degree rating and the Heatseeker Eco (70% polyester, 30% recycled polyester) is weird.  is is cold when you first touch it then gets warmish but after spending hours of trying to get warm, my body was just exhausted of extra heat and the bag just did not help.  also, i often use silk tops for warmth and whatever the dolomite fabric is, it is not happy w/silk as the 2 fabrics would not slide easily across each other.  it was nice to have knee and below movement room but it was just more to try to heat up.  the zippers are confusing even when awake & much worse in the middle of the nite when you have to pee.  no neck collar to keep out drafts was also sorely missed.  when puling the layer/s tight w/the the provided draw strings to compensate for no collar, i quickly remembered there was no mummy bag "head cradle."  i have been sleeping outside for decades & owned 4 bags over my years.   this one is good for the summer nites when it is chilly, but NOT for cold of any type.
review.name: froze my feet
comment:
Hi Gretchen!  Im so sorry for your experience with this bag!  I would personally not recommend a 15 degree synthetic bag for the conditions you experienced.  A 15 degree rating is essentially the lowest survivable temp for a bag to keep you from getting hypothermic--as opposed to being a comfort rating.  

I'd consider this a versatile, 3 season car camping  bag that can handle the occasional cold night, but that's not taking into account those of us that may sleep a bit warmer or cooler than average!

Please feel free to reach out to a Gearhead anytime, we would be very happy to set you up with a free exchange, and even recommend some alternatives for you!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is unbelievably spacious! You can separate the double layer and make it into one LARGE sleeping bag if you need extra space!!
review.name: In love with this!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Buy it !!!!
review.name: A must buy for the camping couple , premium product !!!!

review.reviewBody: If you are perfectly slim, adapt at changing layers on a climatic whim and love the the feel of sleeping on zippers... it is for you. If not, save your pesos. Tried it once and the material will set you up quite a few degrees than expected. And, still waiting on my refund after returning some time ago. So, that happened.
review.name: Ugh. Whatever.

name: Dolomite One Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic

review.reviewBody: I have worn this bag literally everyday for the two weeks I’ve had it. It matches EVERYTHING. It’s the cutest across the chest. Everything from death concerts to daily hikes and quick shopping. It holds so unbelievably much I just keep shoving things in. Holds multiple cards, cash, meds, iPhone 14promax, cigarettes, chapsticks, and sunglasses and probably has a little more room. It’s amazing for an everyday bag. I love it I wish I could post pictures but check my insta @Smlalalalalah92 for outfit inspo with it!

review.reviewBody: I love my Fjallraven accessories! They are functional and stylish!!! My backpack goes to the gym then to shopping and to the office. Everyone comments on how cool and fictional they are. Thank you for making such great products

review.reviewBody:
Would really like it if it had a strap, handle, or at least a wrist strap for hands free carrying.
Prefer it if it was just a touch bigger to easily accommodated a larger phone with case, like an iPhone  14 Pro Max (talking millimetres).
review.name: Needs a strap for hands free carrying and more space for larger phones

review.reviewBody: It's incredibly well built, and feels of amazing quality. I'm sure I'll be using this for years and probably decades. My only disappointment is that it has nothing to attach it to the backpack or something like that. When traveling, this wallet should be accesible at all times and it feels like a huge design flaw that you have to put it in and out of the bag instead of keeping it hanging around while you're at the airport, running through customs or whatever, and then safely putting it in your bag once you're in your plane or outside of the airport. Hope they come up with a v2 that has this perk.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: very durable, keeps all my stuff nice and tidy. it’s very convenient if you have a lot of stuff and don’t want to carry a purse!
review.name: Great wallet

review.reviewBody: My high school aged daughter asked for this item for a history themed spring break trip across Europe for her school in St. Louis. After the trip she continued to use this backpack for school, and used it all summer long, she is rarely without it ! Thanks, Pete
review.name: My daughter loves it !

review.name: Great, order arrived on time

review.name: I LOVE THIS WALLET !!!

review.reviewBody: Great Material, I can drop my keys in it if I want to. Both my Work phone and personal phones fit.

review.itemreviewed: Quantum Hydrastash Thermagraph Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Bib does its job well while maintaining plenty of space to eliminate excess heat. I own plenty of 686 gear and if I had not lost 50 pounds I would not replace any of it. It looks good, has durability and everyone knows they have high quality. When you’re on hill you look like you should be on the hill and know what you’re doing. 686 4 life.
review.name: This Bib does its job

review.itemreviewed: Quantum Hydrastash Thermagraph Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight, good zippers, warm enough for winter but not too warm for spring. Water bladder is a big bonus for staying out on the mountain longer.
review.name: Perfect Bib

review.itemreviewed: Quantum Hydrastash Thermagraph Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve been looking for bibs with a water bladder and this one fits the bill! Also, the feel and quality is amazing. You can’t go wrong with 686 gear. The large size fit me great, I was able to move around very easily and layer clothes.
review.name: I’ve been looking for bibs

review.itemreviewed: Quantum Hydrastash Thermagraph Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought these to have an insulated bib for inbounds riding. I'm 5'7" 135 lbs and bought size small. The bibs are quite large around the waist and crouch, but the waist can be cinched up with the internal waist adjustment. The crouch is not as big an issue with snowboard boots on. Overall, they are slightly large for my preferred fit, but they are comfortable nonetheless. Love the entrance of these bibs compared to the side entrance of most bibs. I really appreciate all the pockets, especially the rear pockets as most brands don't include them on bibs or most snow pants these days. All the pockets are zipper secured which is also great. The hydrastash feature fits seamlessly into the bibs and I hardly notice it's there. Now maybe I'll actually hydrate with something other than beer.
review.name: Great Insulated Bibs

review.itemreviewed: Quantum Hydrastash Thermagraph Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit, adjustability and comfort. Also very warm
review.name: Never thirsty again

review.itemreviewed: Quantum Hydrastash Thermagraph Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great bibs. Performed perfectly in the chest deep blower in AK!
review.name: Blower

review.itemreviewed: Quantum Hydrastash Thermagraph Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The bibs are great. Plenty of pockets with zippers on the right place. I primarily purchased these for the hydration but the bladder & tube/bite valve sucks. The bv leaks easily & the tubing is small diameter. Good concept but they have to reengineer that. 
Insulation is just right & in good locations.
review.name: Nice pants but hydration is horrible

review.itemreviewed: Quantum Hydrastash Thermagraph Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: 686 is a great company. Quality stuff and good price
review.name: 686 is a great company.

review.itemreviewed: Quantum Hydrastash Thermagraph Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'd been wanting bibs for a while, and when I heard about the hydrostash, I knew I had to have these! Hauling water on the mountain is something that always annoyed me. I don't always want to carry a backpack, but that seemed like the only solution. The hydrostash is a gamechanger. No more dehydrated runs when I'm sick of wearing a backpack. Plus they are so warm and waterproof! When I bought them, they only had a size XL left. I would normally have ordered a medium, but honestly I'm kinda digging the baggy fit. Just adjusting the shoulder straps makes it so that they aren't falling off me.
review.name: Love love love the water bladder!

review.itemreviewed: Quantum Hydrastash Thermagraph Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great bib fits great but the hydratsash is already leaking after 2 days of use.
review.name: Hydra stash seems to be faulty

name: Quantum Hydrastash Thermagraph Bib Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Like many here I stumbled out to start making coffee and didn’t realize the cup was still on the bottom. Torched it and at struggling to find the replacement measuring cup. I agree change the color of the cup to stand out. Thankfully stove is fine but the cup is now toast. Help!
review.name: The cup needs an update otherwise fantastic

review.reviewBody: Love this little cook-set and use it for bike-packing. The straining lid is very clever. Super light and perfect for one person. The pot gripper will scratch the inside of the pot, unless you wrap it for storage. A pot handle would have been better. AND.... like many others it seems, after NEARLY doing it twice... I melted the bowl by not noticing and removing it from the pot before firing up the burner. I'm in Australia and it seems like it will an ordeal getting replacement bowl, if possible at all??
review.name: Love it... but....

review.reviewBody: I love this little kit (solo) however I wish that MSR would just add handles to the pot as that would alleviate the need for the pot gripper as it scratches up the pot. It would also alleviate the need for the silicone grip on the pot that eventually slides down anyway. Further, make the bowl orange so that it alerts others to remove the bowl before cooking. It would be nice if you could buy the pieces of this cook set separately in the event of loss or damage otherwise, this is a great system that I really love. It has replaced a few systems that I loved before this. My new go to!
review.name: Great System

review.reviewBody: Silicone ring slipped down while cooking and didnt notice until it was on fire. Any chance I can purchase a replacement part for this?
review.name: Replacement of Silicone ring?

review.reviewBody: Set is compact and works great. Forgot to take the plastic bowl off when making my morning coffee and melted it everywhere. The bowl should be a bright orange color so it is more noticeable. Would love to order a new bowl, but do not see the option on the website
review.name: Works Great, but don't forget the plastic bowl....

review.reviewBody: This is a smaller version of the two person kit. It works really well when I’m backpacking alone! I like having both on hand, though, so I have options!
review.name: Great for solo backpacker

review.reviewBody: Great little stove. Only issue is I have to be careful not to set the flame too high. Same issue as the bigger set that you can melt the silicone ring. Other than that it’s by far my favorite stove!
review.name: Great little stove. Only issue

review.reviewBody: I give it 2 stars for the light weight and the gripper. Sending back. I was trying to beat out my GSI Minimalist Kit for a very slight weight advantage. I love MSR stoves and have had several of their cook kits over the years so I was surprised to see how poorly designed this item is. I venture to say that anyone that loves this kit has never compared it to the GSI Minimalist Kit. Virtually the same size and weight but so much more functional. Pot versus Pot (GSI is lighter). Lid versus Lid (GSI Lid flips to turn the pot to a drinkable cup...once slipped into the neoprene cozy. MSR pot would burn your lips and the provided cup is only cold rated and would burn your hands). Rubber Rand versus Neoprene Cozy (MSR rand could melt if stove flares up and is so narrow there is only a small safe spot for your fingers. The GSI pot is removed from the stove and placed into a full coverage neoprene cozy the keeps one from burning their hands and functions to keep the contents hot). Metal Pot Grabber versus Neoprene Gripper (MSR wins this one. The GSI gripper is virtually weightless but awkward to use and one could find hot liquid steaming their fingers. The MSR gripper is far more functional). Cup versus Cup (The MSR cup is cheap flexible thin plastic that will roast your hands if it has hot liquid in it. It also kind of disappears when stored on the bottom of the pot and people forget about it and melt it on their stove. GSI does not have a separate cup. The pot double functions as a functional insulated cup when placed into the cozy and when the lid is placed on top. For those that think that MSR wins in this area because of a separate cup, you will be disappointed. What are you going to put in it other than a cool drink? It is basically only a measuring cup. Some might not like that you do not get a separate cup with the GSI. If that is important to you, for what it is worth, the included cup that comes with the GSI Soloist Kit, slides right onto the bottom of the Minimalist pot. When this is done, I believe the difference between the two kits is about 2 ounces). I count ounces but 2 to 3 ounces for a fully functional kit versus one that is fraught with issues is a win for me. All GSI needs to do is create a decent pot grabber and it will be a complete Game, Set, Match. NOTE: Do not buy the GSI stoves. They are junk. MSR wins the stove battle at every level. So, in my opinion, MSR Stoves and GSI Cook Kits.
review.name: Weak Design

review.reviewBody: Compact but big enough to fit my burner. It's part of the team now.
review.name: Worked great

review.reviewBody: Worked great until I forgot to take the plastic bowl off the metal canister. Only took seconds to melt the plastic and destroy my stove. Solo cook set was awesome. I was challenged!
review.name: Works great. Boils water in around a minute.

name: Trail Mini Solo Cook Set

review.reviewBody:
Disappointed.  The sleeves were stiff and itchy on the skin, can’t really wear a short sleeve under it.  Also the weird stitching on the sleeves I’m guessing they did for looks, but it looks odd and it prevents the ability to push the sleeves up.  It’s also uncomfortable.  Also, put it on and walked outside, it was like 50 degrees and windy and the wind went right through it and I was cold.  Not a good product. 

I have a few other shirts from SW, and they are all Large.  This Large was a big snug.  And since it was so stiff I wouldn’t have kept it even if it were not itchy.

review.reviewBody: My wife really loves the soft fuzzy fleece on this vest, and the pockets. The hybrid look of the Trico vest is a nice change. The slick upper half wears well, as a layering piece. review.reviewBody: Works as described. Cools fast. Temp can fluctuate a bit. Overall happy.
review.name: SO far SO Good

review.reviewBody: Two separate spaces, with separate control functionality, is a really great feature it works well. Loaded enough fresh food + frozen food for a 4 day trip for 2 people with ease. Power consumption is reasonable - 24 hrs + even at -4*. Connected easily to my phone with Bluetooth. Very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Very cool (get it?) 😎

review.reviewBody: This cooler is a game changer for camping and any other applicable where you need ice/cold water/beverages on demand! The plus is that anker has excellent after sales service and returned the 50l cooler i ordered no questions asked to exchange for the 30L very satisfied with this purchase
review.name: Game changer for camping!

review.reviewBody: Bigger than I expected but we love Everett the everfrost
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody:
I appreciate having the double deep wells (plenty of storage) on either side of the 53l Everfront - because of dimensions the right side cools the fastest.

In my short time using it found, cans cool the fastest but plastic bottles can take a bit longer (overnight) than expected when compared to a traditional refrigerator to get to desired temperature. 

Compressor is quiet but upon start up in a quiet room you definitely will hear it softly fire up before going into a low steady hum. No regrets
review.name: Anker Everfrost 53L

review.reviewBody: This cooler definitely exceeded my expectations. Long battery life and keeps the set temperature.
review.name: This cooler definitely exceeded my

review.reviewBody: We absolutely love it, and everybody we show loves it. We just keep it in our car or our truck. And take it wherever we go,
review.name: Love It

review.reviewBody:
Battery dies in half a day on 32 degrees.
Takes a while to cool down and bluetooth stopped working
review.name: Decent

review.reviewBody: This is the "coolest" piece of tech that I have bought in a long time. The ability to go camping and not have to run to the store for ice is great. It keeps my food cold for around 30 hours. The ability to set the temp to -4 and bring ice cream camping is a must. I recommend buying this with the Anker 625 Solar Panel so that you can keep it charged wherever and however long you need. When not camping, I keep it full of drinks in the basement, running like a mini. fridge all the time.
review.name: Epic Way to Camp and Perfect for Emergencies

review.reviewBody: I have depended on Anker for power needs for years and they don’t disappoint. This cooler is proving to be worthy of my trust in Anker. The construction and features are top notch and the app gives me good access and control. The unit is near silent and maintains temperature well. Thanks for another great product.
review.name: Great tech from trusted name.

name: Everfrost Dual Zone Powered Cooler

I can wear them on bluebird/warm days or blizzard/cold days and be comfortable. The level of water proofing is adequate, unless I’m just sitting still they don’t soak through. Zippers and seams are top notch and weather proof. They are also flattering which isn’t necessarily high in the totem pole but who doesn’t like looking fly on the slopes?! I 100% recommend them and hope this very same style stays in production because I don’t ever want another snowboard pant.

review.reviewBody: The seams on this suit had no integrity, (I assume it was at least a couple of years old but was sold as “new”). As soon as I got in the water it just flooded like I had nothing on…O’Neill quality has always been good so was surprised; I called and got a return authorization so sent it back but still haven’t gotten a refund, (said they’d give me store credit but haven’t gotten that either)…very disappointed w the whole transaction…should have gone to the manufacturer direct so at least could have filed a warranty claim
review.name: O'Neill-O'Neill Hyperfreak Comp 3/2 Zip

review.itemreviewed: Hyperfreak Comp 3/2 Zipless Full Wetsuit - Men's
review.reviewBody:
First off, let me start by saying I own a s#@t ton of wetsuits, as I've been surfing for several decades and like to have suits for every possible temperature and a spare so I always have a dry one for that 2nd session.  I used to love O'neill wetsuits, but found them to fall apart to easily after they came out with the Zen in the 90's. 

Lately, I've been almost exclusively wearing Xcel's upper end suits which are great.  I've had Rip Curls, Body Gloves, Hurleys and even a terrible fitting Billabong (Built-em-wrong).  
I decided to try an O'neill fullsuit again only after hearing and feeling the incredible stretch of their technobutter neoprene.  
Sadly, this super-stretchy suit started to literally unravel between the 2nd and 3rd surf. I kid you not!  I mean my old O'neill Zen zip lost its ability to stay closed in a month or so, based on a horrible Velcro only closure, but this Hyperfreak suit falling apart after 2 surfs was ridiculous!  I didn't even bother to send it in to O'neill after my experience with their horrendous customer service decades ago and my apathy, since I had  many back up suits. I just went back to my Xcel suits and called it a day.  
I do plan to pay to have the neck sewn up and will use the suit again to see if I just got a lemon/ or a second quality from Bakcountry, as I wouldn't put it past them.  Their low price guarantee is anything but...
review.name: Stretchy, but falls apart  immediately!

review.itemreviewed: Hyperfreak Comp 3/2 Zipless Full Wetsuit - Men's
review.reviewBody: I recommend the chest zip instead of the zipless. I had a few different thicknesses in the zipless construction. The cord that tightens it fell apart within a few weeks on all of them.
review.name: Zipless Breaks

review.reviewBody: I am obsessed with these shoes! So comfortable and the color did not disappoint!
review.name: Love These Clifton Shoes

review.reviewBody: I can see now what the hype is about. Very supportive, cushioned and amazingly light weight. Highly recommended!
review.name: Instantly comfortable

review.reviewBody: I love the fit and the comfort. I am an elementary teacher and i am on my feet all day. I wish to a "slip-in" style. Thank you for the makers of Hoka!!!
review.name: I would buy this product again and again.

review.reviewBody: I thought I knew my feet but I was terribly wrong cause when I put on a pair of Hoka's I was in love. I enjoy wearing these Clifford's. They are amazing.....
review.name: Best Shoes Ever !!!!

review.reviewBody: I'm a serial Clifton 8 purchaser and frustrated that they are no longer available. I'm glad the Clifton 9s fit just as well. I like the the heel seems to protrude out the back less than the C8.
review.name: Great Replacement

review.reviewBody: Giving 3 stars because I love this shoe except it's already coming apart in less than 2 months. The worst part has been trying to return for replacement. Emails get kicked back. Try to text, NO RESPONSE. Try to live chat, NO RESPONSE!!! You have to return to UPS store and wait for approval b4 you get a new pair sent. Not good customer care for expensive shoes. Took far too much of my time trying to deal with this. VERY ANNOYING. SO DISAPPOINTING
review.name: Falling apart in less than 2 months

review.reviewBody: I love, love, love my Clifton 9 Hokas, but I wish I selected another color. Mine are too bright for my taste.
review.name: I would buy Hokas again.

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased my first pair of HOKA shoes. I love them. What I love most about them is the thick supportive sole of these shoes. I did need to stretch one shoe to conform to a foot issue but they have worked out great. They are very comfortable and have great support.
review.name: First time buyer

review.reviewBody: I wore the Clifton 8's for years. I trained in them and ran two half marathons in them. I maybe had two pairs over the span of 5 years. I was so excited when they came out with the generation of Clifton because they were the best running shoes I ever had. However, I was disappointed when the clifton 9's I got in January started getting worn down within a matter of months. This was not normal wear and tear - the bottom of the shoe is tearing off and there are now holes in the fabric on top. I never had this issue with the Clifton 8's. They are also bulkier and less comfortable than the 8's. Overall, I wish I could recommend this newer generation of Clifton's but it seems like I will be looking elsewhere for my marathon training show.
review.name: Bring back the Clifton 8!

review.reviewBody: This is my third pair of Clifton 9s. I put about 1000 miles on the second pair. The sole started falling apart... but well worth the cost! They're great!! I order a half size smaller because they run big.
review.name: Great shoes!

name: Clifton 9 Running Shoe - Women's

This is my do everything bike and it has gone through, dry gravel, sand, dusty trails, snow, ice, and puddles and the crankset spins as amazing as it did the day the bottom bracket went in. I was teetering on getting the steel BB, but opted for the ceramic. If you have the extra cash to spend on the ceramic, get it! But Chris King does not make poor products, so whatever you buy from them will be good quality and work as intended.
