review.reviewBody: 舒服，轻便，很好的一双运动休闲鞋。
review.name: 非常喜欢

review.reviewBody: Great shoes!  Love the style, fit was spot on.  Will buy another pair when available on sale.
review.name: Comfy!

review.reviewBody:
Well made versatile shoe with solid rock plate, toe guard, and rigid soles. Apply some water proofing and they will keep your feet dry in wet conditions and slush. I wear these mostly for around town, but they seem perfect for flat pedal gravel biking and for the <7 mile hike. The rigid soles would make my feet tired for longer distances. 

My feet are narrow and I sized down (a suggested by a different review). I am usually a US 12, these are 45.5. My other hikers are LaSportiva 47, which run small. 

If you have wide feet these may not be for you.
review.name: Great for trail and town

review.reviewBody:
I've had the shoe for years.  I want to like them more, but unfortunately the toe box is really low profile and consistently gives me blisters on top of my toes.  Blisters are pretty uncommon for me, I've run tons of ultra marathons in running shoes and finished with no blisters at all.

I've decided these shoes are better for kicking around town and not for long days in the backcountry.
review.name: Better for "Lifestyle" than long days

review.reviewBody: I love Scarpa Shoes.  This was the third pair of Mojitos that I have owned.  The first two fit like a glove.  Perfect for my feet and use.  For whatever reason this pair was terrible.  The fit was at best odd no matter how I laced it up.  They must have changed the shoe last or did something different in the manufacture.  They were fundamentally unwearable.  Other than that they are great looking and seemingly well put together -- but very disappointing.
review.name: Bad Fit

review.reviewBody: These shoes are the best I have ever had. Lite, comfortable, and look good. I love the laces that run all the way to your toes.
review.name: Fantastic !!!

review.reviewBody: I put them on the first time and they were very comfortable and also provide great support and the sole is perfect for living in the mountains!
review.name: Scarpa Mojito Great Fit Out of the Box!

name: Mojito Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: This bag is everything I wanted and more. Thanks for a great product.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag to replace my old backpack for "under the seat carryon travel".  The bag is AMAZING, great quality and super amazing fabric - however; having it sideways was a bit awkward for me and the ridge that support the internal frame might be a bit difficult to fit "under the seat" on the airplane.  The buckle was challenging to open/close and the there needs to be external drink pockets so that drinks don't get computer/papers/internal stuff wet.  Like I said - amazing bag, just not right for my particular needs.
review.name: Great back, but kind of awkward...

review.reviewBody: I needed a large bag for the office that could hold everything I would need for the day, keep it all accessible, and look the part. The 3 way 27 briefcase does everything I hoped it would and more. It’s a large bag that isn’t overly bulky. When it’s full it’s as big as it needs to be and no more, and when it isn’t it scales down without the need for a bunch of compression straps just slim, compact, and lite. I haven’t had the opportunity to travel with it yet but I’m sure that will just make it all the better. As most have said in their reviews I had to add a pad to the shoulder strap (inexpensive leather strap pad from Etsy) as the strap is a bit too sharp for the weight this bag can hold. With the pad it’s perfect so don’t let the strap talk stop you.
review.name: Very versatile bag!

review.reviewBody:
Good size, not to large either. 

Carry strap is pretty basic, nothing wrong with it, just a nylon strap.

Quality is solid, good zippers. 

Overall very happy.
review.name: Great quality, good size,

review.reviewBody: I've one cross country business trip on it and have been very impressed.  It inhales my laptop, additional travel monitor, menagerie of cordage, headsets, notebooks, water bottles, etc. and hasn't tapped out yet.  The shoulder strap could be wider as others have called out but I've resolved that with a 3rd party shoulder strap pad from a previously owned messenger bag.  The stowable backpack straps are the preferred choice for longer term carry as they are plush and well executed.  11 out of 10, would recommend.  Now if only they would make a clip in padded holster and mag carrier.
review.name: A well organized bottomless pit.

review.reviewBody: Great Bag - Roomy and durable. Good combo of computer bag and knapsack.
review.name: Great Bag - Roomy and durable.

review.reviewBody:
The website pictures must be over brightened - the “Tiger’s Eye” is actually burnt orange color. I’m disappointed as I need to use this bag and won’t be able to return it. Love the bag, not happy with the color as I wanted the brighter orange one pictured to help the bag stand out so I wouldn’t forget it at places. 

I would recommend this bag, but MR should post more accurate photos and/or consider a color name that isn’t misleading.
review.name: Tiger’s Eye = Burnt Orange/Brown

review.reviewBody: I bought the a couple weeks ago and I am so happy that I did as it replaced the smaller version which for me wasn’t doing the trick. I’m a Rabbi and I bring along several different books and a laptop and tablet everywhere I go.  This bag magically swallows my whole load and doesn’t get crowded at all!  Nor does it feel overly heavy. I’m super happy!  I should have known that you guys would have come up with a bag that just gets the job done.
review.name: Unbelievable Room!

review.reviewBody:
I have been looking for an EDC bag that would work for me in and around my squad car. I have been using this bag for the last few days and it seems to be good to go at this time. There are still some features I am looking for...but this is close. 

I like the quick access of the front pocket,
I like the two zipper areas....nicely appointed
I like the backpack retention 

I very much dislike the cheap shoulder strap....I put a Briggs and Reilly strap on mine. 
I would like an outside attachment location for a tourniquet.
I
review.name: Mystery Brief

review.reviewBody: Great bag, not too bulky but expands when needed. Only wish is that it had a few more smaller zip pouches/small device holders and pen/pencil holders- it is a briefcase afterall.
review.name: Love It!

name: 3 Way 27 Backpack

review.reviewBody: Well, all I can say is they have become my go to shoes.
review.name: My Go To

review.reviewBody: Great purchase, very comfortable and match most of my wardrobe. I only gave four stars because they run loose, and the heel is quite heavy These two issues are not tolerable, and not worth me sending them back but I have about ten pair of Sorels and have never felt like the shoes were too heavy or run loose. I have a small bunion,  these still feel loose.
review.name: Great purchase, but run a tad loose.

review.reviewBody: Way too wide - such a disappointment. I love the cushion and the quality but I think I need to buy some elastic if I want to take a walk in these shoes
review.name: Whoa Width

review.reviewBody:
Very stylish, well made and so comfy. I've bought two pairs and will most likely pick up the black.
The shoes are a bit heavy and it would have been great if the insoles were textured instead of smooth to give your feet something to grip.
review.name: Fabulous

review.reviewBody: Tongue too high. Not attractive for average length muscular legs. Will look great on someone who is 5’7 or taller with thin 🦵
review.name: So excited so disappointed
comment: Hello Sylvia, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry ONA AVE™ Women's Loafer didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.reviewBody: Just got the black and plan on getting another color. So comfortable and cute.
review.name: Love ‘em!

review.reviewBody: They’re all I wear now. Didn’t take too long for the suede to break in. It’s like walking on air. Solid construction -  think they’ll hold up well. I get complements every time I wear them. They need these in 20 colors, and do some with leather uppers.
review.name: Best summer shoe ever!

review.reviewBody: I bought this Jacket last month and took it on my trip to Europe.  The jack looks great and kept me warm in unpredictable European spring weather.  The jacket is very light so it made it very easy for me to carry in my backpack.  I do recommend this jacket if you need something light but with good warmth for 35+ degree weather.
review.name: Kuhl Down Jacket

review.reviewBody: I have a curvy body and this jacket is so comfortable; I ski in it.   Most puffy jackets are stiff, especially in the armpit area, but not this jacket, they put in a flexible fabric that's magic!  I just bought the same jacket for my sister.
review.name: Best jacket ever!  Flexable and warm.

review.reviewBody: It's a beautiful coat but runs very small. Be sure to order a size larger than you think you need.
review.name: Beautiful Coat

review.reviewBody: I found this to be flattering because it wasn't overly puffy but it was too tailored for me. I would have to size up then it would be too big in other areas. Also, the collar came up very high and kept hitting me in the face, I couldn't imagine driving in it. I understand it is good when you are all zipped up and need to keep extra warm but for every day the collar was just in the way. Nice jacket, but a few faults for me to keep it.
review.name: Cute but uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: Returned and reordered in a larger size. I ordered a Medium and when received found it was the exact same size as my Patagonia down sweater jacket in size XS which was much too small. I have just ordered a size L to see if it fits better. I generally wear a size 6 top (Patagonia size S, Maramot size S, J.Crew blazer size 6).
review.name: Runs very small

name: Spyfire Down Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great shoes, very comfortable and warm! They were exactly what I was looking for in a boot
review.name: Great boots!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and stylish waterproof boots.  Wore all day on trip to NYC and feet stayed comfy and dry.
review.name: Comfy and Stylish

review.reviewBody: Great winter boots. Can tell it’s made of good material and will keep my feet warm on cold days. I ordered half size up in case I wanted to wear thicker socks, but the fit well
review.name: Great winter boots

review.reviewBody: They look great and are comfortable to wear all day and are a sturdy shoe.
review.name: Looks great

review.reviewBody: Oh my days! So comfortable, I want every colour! Just the best boots. I’m so smug wearing them because they’re cool looking but I feel like I’m in supportive slippers.
review.name: Perfect cosy boots

review.reviewBody: These are quality material, look as pictured, and are comfortable. They also fit true to size. Now I need them in more colors!
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: Bought 2 pair on sale, one shoe in particular is extremely narrow. I know this issue has nothing to do with my feet, as the black pair fit excellent, no issues. The sand colored pair fits good on the left foot only, just like the black pair, but the right shoe is considerably smaller/more narrow! It literally crushes my foot/toes due to how tight and narrow it is compared to the other shoes. They both say size 9. Buyer beware, you may receive an inconsistent product. I don't think I could break in the right shoe even if I tried.
review.name: Beware inconsistent sizing!!!
comment: Hello Christina M, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our EXPLORER STRT™ Women's Chelsea Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: These boots are so comfortable and I love this  style. They feel like they are well made and will last a long time. They will be my staple for winter months!

review.reviewBody: Hardly any break in period (just wear thicker socks for a day) and wore walking 5 miles in Chicago with zero aches or pains the next day!

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable boots and I like that the sizing goes up to 43! I also like that they are weather proof and also great looking to wear at work, those two things are sometimes hard to achieve when choosing shoes for winter time in Finland.
review.name: Great fit and good looking

review.itemreviewed: Alp Trainer Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Toddlers'
review.reviewBody:
Purchased two of these…so my size could grow from one into the next and this could be a lengthier time study with a goretex toddler hiking boot - something rather scarce in the market place compared to adults. 

Overall, very happy with the boots. The first set of boots which were used as his camp shoes prior to and during a 95 mile rafting trip in Eastern Oregon with environmental conditions including hail, rain and the glorious sun, are still sending it hard. 

I’ve checked several times on the waterproofing of these boots because my son likes to jump into puddles and shallow water despite my requests not to. Thus, giving ample opportunity to pull the boots off and check to see how well the goretex is doing. And it is holding well, comparable to my Lowa, Arc Tryx, and Vasque goretex waterproofness.

Lightweight compared to waterproof boots available to toddlers. Not a lot of goretex options in this category so what is available is generally much heavier than these boots. So, it also makes for a better all around boot for going out on rainy days around the yard, for a walk or to the park. Less “clunky” and thus, less concerns for catching or tripping compared to say my toddler’s Boggs or rain boots.
review.name: Durable, Lightweight and Waterproof

name: Alp Trainer Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Toddlers'

review.reviewBody: I have used this on two trips for a total of 4 days.  So take my review under that consideration.  Overall, the temp rating  on this one is pretty inaccurate.  It is nowhere near a 0 degree bag.  I'd optimistically give it a +15 rating myself.  I've gotten pretty cold in it and all nights I've used it in were in the high teens to low 20's fahrenheit.  Fit in the shoulders also seems to be the tightest of any bag I've ever owned.  Even though the specs indicate its middle of the road... hasVariant.name: Cyclone II 36L Dry Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the DAKINE Cyclone II 36L Dry Backpack online or shop all Surf from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought for an adventure trip to the Galapagos. Used as my carry on for the air travel then used for 1 or more ship to shore transports a day for an 8 day cruise. Kept everything dry in rough seas and for wet landings. Holds alot but can be closed down to fit under an airline seat if needed. Laptop sleeve is a real plus to get through airport security. Still looks like new after bouncing around the deck of a zodiac and laying in the sand. Definitely waterproof when sealed as directed. Probably floats but I did not test that.
review.name: Worked well for 10+ daily wet landings

review.reviewBody: I'm not a surfer, but I use this pack for camping and day trips. It's like a big drybag-backpack, which is why I bought it. It's really comfortable, holds a lot of gear (plus my laptop!), and keeps everything dry. 4 Stars because one of the zippers on an exterior pocket came off shortly after I bought it. I put it back on without issue, but it looks like there's no zipper stop on that particular zipper so I need to be careful it doesn't come off again. Seems like a manufacturing mistake, and it's not a deal breaker, but check your zippers before you use your pack!
review.name: Great Waterproof Pack

name: Cyclone II 36L Dry Backpack

review.reviewBody:
Bought these in conjunction with The North Face Summit Series $1k pants.

Considering the price difference, these pants are SWEET.

Both are 1000 fill. The WM pant are designed to a lighter overall weight. Size was true. Zippers work very well. Wear patches are nicely placed. Pants are ergonomically excellent. Easy tighten waist. 

This pair will be my goto cold weather pant to a point. The North Face Summit pants will take over where the WM pants leave off.
review.name: Lots of pant at a low price.

review.reviewBody:
The keep you warm while stationary, at camp, resting etc. The zippers go down the entire length of the leg meaning you can basically "butterfly" them and then reassemble them over your legs so you do not need to remove your trousers. If conditions get freezing you can have them on in minutes and no need to remove your gloves. They are always in my pack now whenever I go on winter hikes as they compress down to nothing and weigh like air. 

One issue though, or perhaps a warning. I put these on the other day on the summit as it was -10. I had crampon on and decided to move down the hill before taking them off. The crampons ripped a hole the second they came into contact with the fabric. I guess some studier fabric on the inside cuff would have been a nice touch, but then again it would have added to the weight. 

I put the cuffs over boots, with a bib gaiter and did not find the cuffs too tight which other reviewers have raised as an issue. Perhaps this bug was fixed.
review.name: Always in my winter pack

name: Flight Down Pant - Men's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Mega Bug Tent: 4-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mega Bug Tent: 4-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Mega Bug Tent: 4-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The Black Diamond Mega Bug 4P is a fantastic tent and pairs perfectly with the Mega Light 4P tent. The one issue is that it has different dimensions than the previous version and they cannot be switched out easily. It would have been better if they kept the size the same.
review.name: Great Tent!

review.reviewBody: I purchased the mega bug and mega lite to use with my wife and son on canoe trips and backpacking adventures. The two pieces can be used separately or together. We love how roomy the whole setup is! The only improvement I'd ask for are some more pockets on the inside of the mega bug.
review.name: The super roomy megabug

review.reviewBody: I used this bug tent inside my Mega Light for 10 days of running the Zambezi. Slept soundly with the peace of mind that critters and crawlers would stay outside. Even survived a minor 0300 flood event when I had to wake up and drag everything uphill, with some gear still inside! Worth the long-awaited back order!
review.name: Up to the task in Zambia!

review.reviewBody: We went with the Mega Light and Mega Bug when we needed a four person tent for a recent family trip to Yellowstone (2 adults and 2 kids). The bug insert performed really well. With used with the Mega Light there are some tricks to staking it out so that the netting does not get wet with condensation over night and can be packed dry from underneath. Keep some tension on the tie outs and use a rock or small stick to ensure that the Bug basin/netting tie outs are at ground level and that the tent tie outs are at the top of the stake (separated by about 6 cm). This will make sense the first time you pitch the tent.
review.name: Great Addition

review.reviewBody: If you're a fan of mega mids, but you're going to be in wet climate like the Appalachians, Cascades, or Alaska then this is the perfect pair. Keep the light weight and ease of set up but you have a floor for the mud and a net for the mosquitos
review.name: An addition that pairs well with a mid

review.reviewBody: If your travels take you anywhere with insects, this is an essential insert beneath a Megalight tent.
review.name: Essential insert for the Megalight!

review.reviewBody: We camped by a small lake in Ontario, marshy woodland all around. The mosquitoes were thick, yellow, and lazy, swarming and waiting just outside our tent, which effectively kept them at bay.
review.name: Kept the mosquitoes out!

review.reviewBody: Got the mega bug to compliment our mega light for when the family travels. Helps with keeping the bugs out, especially when we're keeping the mega light open for venting. Helps provide that basic in between when you're coming from a regular tent back ground. Looking forward to using it more!
review.name: Nice Insert for the Mega Light!

review.reviewBody: Very well made and thoughtful design. The tent (including support pole/stakes) is very lightweight. I like that it has a pocket at the top to hang a light if needed. Looking forward to some bug-free summer camping!
review.name: Nice tent

review.reviewBody: This is my second mega bug. My dogs jumped through the netting of the old one a couple times, and after a number of patches, I just decided to replace it with a new one. Great design, spacious, and super fast and easy to set up. With the rain fly, the bathtub floor keeps your dry from the rain up here in Oregon. I've done a lot of backpacking in the PNW with this tent, and even took it for a bicycle tour through the Netherlands a couple years ago. I highly recommend!
review.name: Awesome ten!

name: Mega Bug Tent: 4-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: The shirt looks nice and fits me fine but the fabric is very rough, definitely not something I want next to my skin.  Sadly, going back.
review.name: Rough Fabric

review.reviewBody: This is the second Merino Crew that I have bought. I very much enjoy the first so needed a second. I use this as a base layer for snowboarding, hiking, and everyday wear under a button up. I wear it as my outer layer over a t-shirt for mountain biking. They wash up great and have been very durable compared to my 100% wool base layers. The fit and colours are great. My only complaint was that it was a tad scratchy at the start, but has become softer with use.
review.name: Excellent base layer

review.reviewBody: I have 3 different versions of this top now.  It’s a great base layer. I think it runs a bit large, since size small fits me and isn’t tight.  I’m 5’7” and 140lb and medium would be huge on me.
review.name: Great base layer

review.reviewBody: Keeps me warm, lightweight and helps with sweat too! True to size.
review.name: Perfect baselayer

review.reviewBody: I was in need of a new base layer and was excited to see the merino wool crewneck. When I opened the package, I was very surprised and thought that I had received the wrong item. It is very thin, so thin that it is see through. Does not feel like a warm material at all. I will be returning.
review.name: This does not feel like a base layer to me

review.reviewBody:
The Alpine Onset has lived in my apparel quiver for a couple years now, and it is my go to for an active, cold weather base layer.  It's comfortable, dries quickly, and is much less expensive than a 100% wool alternative.  Having the wool content allows it to feel comfortable against my skin, but the synthetic content allows it to dry more quickly and last longer.  It is clearly more durable than my 100% base layers and I can wash and dry it without fear of it shrinking!  YAY!  You will love it!

Leta
OR Rep
review.name: A great basic for my apparel quiver

review.reviewBody: I use as my base layer on hikes when it is around a freezing temperature. Always keeps me warm!
review.name: Warm and cozy base

review.reviewBody: All the wool companies are making the long sleeve crews now, but none are long enough to go past the waist and really stay tucked in! Also, OR's is shaped perfectly for a female body - comfortable sculpting, but not ridiculously narrow. People who are sensitive to the texture of wool might struggle with it...not the softest out there, but I have zero issues with it.
review.name: Best fitting wool crew!

review.reviewBody: Nice underwater. A bit higher price point than I would normally pay for a under layer .
review.name: Great shirt well made.

review.reviewBody: looks amazing on! could just wear as a black shirt any day
review.name: 10/10 would buy another

name: Alpine Onset Crew - Women's

review.reviewBody: I would NOT recommend putting this on a carbon bike.  If you have an AL or steel frame then it is a great option for storing goodies. I could store keys, phone, light, multitool, cliff bars, and a light-weight rain jacket with no problems.
review.name: Scratched the Clear Coat

review.reviewBody:
I like the bag. It does stay straight on the bike and hauls exactly what I wanted it to. The only problem I have experienced is the small end has created a worn spot on the top tube of my bike that's pretty significant. If you can tolerate that it's a great bag. I ride 100 miles a week..

Tony
review.name: Good Bag

review.reviewBody:
I bought this because during the summertime I prefer a looser fitting tech t-shirt over a jersey, and needed to make up for the lack of pocket space. This bag is nice and sturdy, and doesn't wobble on the frame. 

I only have a single 1/4 inch spacer underneath my stem and had no issues with the front buckle. I haven't had any issues with my knees hitting the bag as I'm pedaling either, but there is some very slight rubbing if I'm climbing out of the seat. 

The bag is large enough to fit two inner tubes, phone, ID/credit card, a gel, a couple of fig newtons, and some beef jerky. If you put your extra tubes in a saddle pack though you could fit more snacks. The way the zipper is positioned you could also carry a portable charger and run a cord to your bike computer. It's awesome to have your stuff right there in front of you, instead of having to blindly fumble with jersey pockets or try and pull something out of your saddle bag on the go. 

I haven't had this long enough to comment on whether it's going to mar the frame long-term, but the lack of wobbling leads me to believe no. There's also a felt piece where the front bottom corner contacts the frame/headset that's intended to prevent any scratches or paint rubbing.
review.name: Perfect size, doesn't wobble

name: TopLoader Top Tube Bag

description: Buy the Kelty Redwing 36L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Redwing 36L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kelty Redwing 36L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Nice quality bag. Its advertised as a day pack but if you get the right gear you can fit a full set of overnight camping gear and food for a one night trip. No need to buy hyperlight for low weight backpacking, this kelty bag is low weight and a great low price! I fit an MSR elixir 1p tent and a Nemo 20° bag in this pack. If you buy a trekking pole tent and a quilt it would fit even better.
review.name: Got a full set of overnight gear in this

review.reviewBody:
Probably a great pack for day hikes, and possibly an overnight, but too many design flaws that hinder functionality...
- Main compartment has steep taper that limits use of bottom of pack
- Inside sleeve only useful for hydration bladder; will not work with laptop
- Front pocket is just a pouch with an opening just big enough for hand to pass through; no organization ability
- Side zipper pockets are either too small or too large
- Bottom side pouches will only work with small bottles, or as ?stop? for something like trekking poles; quart/liter canteen or bottle will fit, but side pockets above interfere with access
- Bungee cord on front will catch easily on external objects (branches, car seat lever, etc)
So, what?s good about it...?  Lightweight with good padding and fabrics; good fit to the back for those with large arm movement.
The bottom line is that it will likely be best only for those using a hydration bladder, and gear for an overnight outdoors, but definitely not suited for those who are looking for a versatile pack that can work with City to Trail use.
review.name: Good Concept, But Limited Function

name: Redwing 36L Backpack

review.reviewBody: For years I had the smallest version since it took up the least amount of space in a pack or suitcase, but I found it relatively uncomfortable since from the knees down I was on cold, hard ground (I'm 5'1). I finally got around to buying the regular size and WOW does that make all the difference in the world. I sleep so well when I'm camping with this sleeping pad. My only complaint is now this one is like a foot too long! I wish there was a size in between small and regular, maybe a 65 inch or something.
review.name: Fantastic!

review.reviewBody: I found myself planning to sleep in a tent for the first time in about 40 years. At 6'5, and not used to roughing it, I was looking for an extra long mattress or pad that would be both comfortable and easy to transport. This pad did a perfect job for me.
review.name: Comfortable and easy to transport

review.reviewBody: I'm only looking at getting another one because of how long I've owned it. It is the most comfortable pad I've ever slept on. Leading me to believe it contains one inch of miracle foam. I would ask how has it survived me, I am amazed. Sign me, Happy Ole Guy
review.name: I have had my trail scout for many years.

review.reviewBody: Pack weight for the trail is to heavy and r value is low. Was uncomfortable.
review.name: Pack weight for the trail

review.reviewBody: I got my 'Trail Scout' pad and called "Therm-a-rest," when it would not 'self-inflate,' not even after several hours. The person I spoke with told me "You don't understand the functioning of the wing lock." (para-phrase) I went to the video just in case I misread the printed instructions. No dice. The video CONFIRMED that the pad was N O T 'self-inflating.' ("Breath inflation" is the term used in the video.) The foam in the pad does not create an inflation vacuum, to be topped-off, like a self-inflating pad. I have a "Cabela's" and N O W, a "Sea-to-Summit" pad that A R E both 'self-inflating.' Both require 3-5 breaths to achieve desired firmness, but they do the majority of the inflation themselves when the valve is opened and the foam expands to draw air into the pad. The "Thermarest" pad is N O T 'self-inflating.' It is not one of those with a foot-pump or stuff sack bladder inflation method either. This product is M I S L A B E L E D. (I hope they correct it; if not , be advised accordingly.
review.name: N O T a "self-inflating" pad as advertised

review.reviewBody: Works reasonably well as a backpacking pad. Kept me warm in cool, wet weather. Packs small enough for a multi day trip. Low cost makes it a good value compared to other sleeping pads.
review.name: Works reasonably well as a

review.reviewBody:
This pad is a great value from Therm-a-Rest, who makes nothing but high quality products, and it's no exception. It's not a thick pad, only about 1", but it's surprisingly comfortable on most terrain due to its dense foam insulation, which also gives it some warmth.

There are certainly lighter pads. There are more comfortable pads. There are warmer pads. But this entry into the Therm-a-rest family of self-inflating pads gets the job done. if you aren't interested in air-only, or close cell foam pads, and want something durable with real insulation and don't have deep pockets, for the price this pad may be for you.
review.name: Great Value from a Trusted Brand

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, tough, stows small, simple to use. Works well as a floating pad for the lake.
review.name: Quality pad, fair price

review.reviewBody: I used this sleeping pad for a field school season, where I was sleeping in a tent for about a month. It was comfy, and it was comfy on the ground!
review.name: It gets the job done for the price!

review.reviewBody: Good product. This is versatile and durable for hiking trips !
review.name: Good product. This is versatile

review.reviewBody:
I love this jacket! I have been wanting to replace my bulky old down jacket for quite some time.
I need water/wind proof with sealed seems and insulation and this jacket fit the bill! It even has features I did not even know I wanted-HA! Like a hood that can accommodate a helmet, underarm zippers to disperse heat, wrist & waist guards designed to keep snow out. The feature that really got me was a small, invisible tracking device to help rescue workers locate you. could come in handy next time I miss the last gondola down lol. I especially love the color-very different from what I've seen out there! I am 5'4'' 112 pounds and ordered an XS. It fit but I like to layer up and it felt somewhat constricted across the chest. I returned it for a S and it fits perfectly. Which brings me to Backcountry. I was worried about purchasing online. What if it was a hassle to return if the size was off? Nope. Returning was effortless & a quick turnaround for the proper size. There was a nominal return fee but the jacket went on sale in the interim! Backcountry has far the most (in my opinion) selection of apparel from different companies both online and in person stores and you. can't beat the prices & save sales. Backcountry will be my go to from now on. I have already ordered more things for my upcoming ski trip and will continue to shop here in the future! Mountain Hardware makes a great jacket& Backcountry is a great place to shop!
review.name: Amazing features!

review.reviewBody: I've been looking for an inexpensive but functional jacket for a few years. The Maven Jacket was the answer. I was skeptical about the size - M - because I am a seasoned woman with seasoned hips, and didn't want to go up a size and have arm length issues. But the fit is good, though I haven't tried the jacket with my ski pants or the layers for upper body. I like the armpit fit and its nice to have arm zippers for cooling down. The sleeves have a snug fit over the wrist that will help keep my body heat whether I wear long ski gloves or not. The only thing I would have liked more is to have a removable hood. I bought the jacket before the ski season so I can't say how it works in the snow. However, my major concerns about fit and function get 4.5 stars
review.name: Great value, good fit for hippy shape

review.reviewBody: The jacket was comfortable and good quality. However the shape was a bit odd for me with a flare at the bottom even with cinching so wound up returning
review.name: Loved the jacket just not the shape

review.reviewBody: Love the styling, warmth, features. I’m 5’2”, 115 lbs and the XS fit me best.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: Great jacket!  Large pockets.. easy to wear.. breathable and waterproof.
review.name: Stand out with this jacket

review.reviewBody: I’ve worn a couple times skiing now and I LOVE my new jacket. The hand gaiters and helmet compatible hood keep me so warm in cold winds. I love the high neck to tuck my face into and it seems to have the perfect amount of insulation. I’m 5’2” and the Small fits perfect with room to layer underneath if needed.
review.name: Excellent warm jacket!

review.reviewBody: like the full neck and hood and plenty of pockets, but wish it were a little bit longer.  Medium is pretty fitted around chest, middle and hips but the neck is wide and needs to be zipped up to stay warm and sleeves are perfect.  This did not keep me warm enough on a cold-er Colorado ski day, but was great for warm spring-like weather.
review.name: Nice coat, wish it were a little longer

review.reviewBody: Great coat. Warm, big collar to tuck your face into, comfortable
review.name: Great purchase

name: Powder Maven Jacket - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: They are the most comfortable of all my walking shoes. Thank you
review.name: My Hoka Shoes

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This was my third pair of Hokas...Clifton's, Biondis and now the Challenger. I couldn't wait for them to come in....then they did, and I put them on...and almost immediately something in my knees felt funny. So I took them off and waited for the lock laces and it wasn't so bad...thinking they were maybe too tight and using the wrong socks. They feel really RIGID. Yesterday, I took the longest walk and I could not wait to get home, and I wanted to chop my left foot off because it hurt so bad. This morning, I put my Biondis on and all is well again...wow. Too late to return and it really sucks because I love the new color combo, but I just can't wear these any more.
review.name: Love the colors...but these kill my foot and knees

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Only shoes I buy for all my endurance events and every day for that matter! Worth the money - my feet always thank me! :)
review.name: Love these shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: There is no way these shoes are Gore Tex, my feet were soaked, so disappointed in the quality for the cost, Hoka's arent what they used to be.
review.name: defective..?

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Good sneakers. Good for walking. I wear 9 and ordered 9. They feel a bit too big. Have used them twice and walked total of 6 miles.
review.name: Good choice

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these because I loved the color, when I put them on, I was skeptical, but when I took them out for a walk, I was very impressed with the soft comfort, like walking on pillows and I can feel the support and stability! I'd recommend these and will be ordering a couple others styles that are meant for just walking! I waited a year to purchase, as I just loved the color I'd chosen, I wish I'd gotten them sooner☺️
review.name: Most comfortable sneakers I've ever worn

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I use the Challenger 7 GTX for all my hikes. Did two 13 mile plus hikes in them and they are great. I wish they'd bring back more colors. I may try the Stinson, but I like the waterproof feature on the Challenger I recommend them to my girlfriends
review.name: I love these shoes

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Like they are rugged & waterproof; but the worst foot feeling to wear during the rainy season. Feet feel miserable. My other Hoka are better.
review.name: Hurt Your Feet

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Since my doctor told me I had plantar fasciitis I searched for a shoe that would give me pain relief from my feet and knees. I tried hoka and have been a proud wearer every since. The soles of these shoes are like little clouds from heaven. Hoka is now my go-to shoe.
review.name: Proud hoka owner

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have worn Challenger for years with great fit and comfort - wore out my 6's.These 7's are a huge disappointment! Too narrow in the tow box, the raised lip pm at the heel is not comfortable- my heel slips!!! I tried to get them to feel comfortable but they don't work! Returned.
review.name: I am very disappointed in this product!

name: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the Ursack Allmitey Bear Bag online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Allmitey Bear Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ursack Allmitey Bear Bag online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Holds a decent amount of food in the bag. Very durable. The rope that ties the bag shut is plenty long enough to secure the bag to the base of a tree in case there isn't a suitable place to hang it out of reach. Easy to pack.
review.name: Great outdoor bag.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I didn’t have an overnight camping trip scheduled to try the URSACK in the field, so I lent this to some friends who were camping in the PNW. They were impressed by how much lighter and easy to transport the URSACK was compared to their normal bear canister (and flexibility in stuffing it full and folding it when it emptied!), and reported that their foods and toiletries stayed safe and dry on their trip. They are now looking to get their own URSACK, and I’m excited to try it for myself on a camping trip later this summer.
review.name: Great alternative to a bear canister!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Pretty cool but honestly won’t use that much to give it an amazing review. But it seems pretty durable. Would be nice if you lived in California or some where we bears are around. So I can’t say how well it works on keeping animals out!
review.name: Nice sac

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is extremely durable and heavy duty, definitely can't it it with a knife so I 100% believe it keeps critters out very well. It is slightly bigger than the size of a regular drawstring bag. Very lightweight bag that can fit 5 days worth of food for 1 person, depending on the size of the items you put inside you can maybe fit more. I was very excited to bring it with me while out on hiking/camping trips and it has worked very well.
review.name: Very durable!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I failed to take a picture while the bag was actually in use, but overall, I like the bare bag much better than the bear canister. Previously I’ve used bear canisters and it seemed very heavy for backpacking. This is great one to two night backpacking trip and I look forward to using it more this summer!
review.name: In love with this bag, can’t wait to use more!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm really surprised about the durability of this product and how strong it is. It is super lightweight and yet it feels like there's no way that I could cut through it. A part of me wanted to test it by stabbing it with a knife if I have to be honest. 
I'm definitely going to bring this to my next hiking or camping trip and I'm glad that it is very flexible so that it can fit in my backpack.
The only negative thing comes to the sowing of it which is why it doesn't get full Stars.
review.name: Sturdy and practical

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is EXTREMELY durable. Very heavy duty. The size of a typical drawstring  backpack which makes it easy to hang from somewhere and carry anywhere. I cannot wait to use this camping as it seems like it will be keeping ANYTHING safe.
review.name: Very versatile and durable camping go-to bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Product is made extremely durable to withstand some major punishment. It is a little on the heavier side if trying to cut weight but is better to other alternatives on the market.  Would recommend adding an odor proof liner inside to add suppression of food smell completely
review.name: Durability

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If you need a bear-bag for the back country - this one has what you need! Cavernous tunnel design that fits easily in 50L+ packs - cinch cord on top, and enough kevlar to keep a dinosaur from getting into your chow! 

Disclaimer - I only had a 5lb critter to do product testing, but, after fervent effort, she could absolutely not scratch or bite her way to the peanut butter snacks inside - and the bag still looks brand new!

Seriously - this bag would be tough to bust. When I am expedition kayaking in the far north, PNW, AK, or climbing through the rockies - this is gonna be my go-to vault for food!
review.name: One of the toughest bear bags on the market!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great size and easy to pack given the mobility of the fabric. Very light in comparison to others options and it seems pretty durable. Just wish it had an additional closing mechanism than just the ties that could help seal it shut better. Haven’t tested it against a bear yet, but the lightweight durability gets a thumbs up.
review.name: Durable Lightweight Option

name: Allmitey Bear Bag

review.reviewBody:
I was overdue for a new liner but have procrastinated this purchase since, frankly, there are things that are much more exciting to spend money on than padded underpants. But I wanted to get this right so I did my research and narrowed my search to 3 candidates: the Terry Aria, Zoic Essential, and POC Essential Short liners. In case you’re at a similar crossroads, I’ll share my impressions and which liner I ultimately chose.

I’m a fit 5’6” woman, ~130 lbs, mid-30’s, with the sturdy upper legs and saddle of a mountain biker. I’m a little more padded than I’d like to be, but petite by most standards. I’m typically a XS/2/26 in street clothes, though after reading reviews claiming that all 3 of these liners ran small, I ultimately ordered a small in the Terry and Zoic shorts and a medium in the POCs. Note that this turned out to be the correct size for me in each short. Here’s how my head-to-head comparison shook out.

POC Essential Liner:
Hands down, these had the best chamois of the bunch. Dense but not bulky padding with a natural shape. I also liked the fabric of the shorts themselves. As promised, it did offer light compression. The shorts were well-shaped and felt like they wouldn’t need to be tugged up all the time. This is the only short of the 3 that has silicone leg grips, if that matters to you. But that is unfortunately where the virtues of these shorts ended. The length and band construction was an unequivocal dealbreaker. With a 2.5-3 inch inseam, the legbands squeezed my thighs at the widest point. And not just a little squeeze…I have never worn a garment that made me feel more grotesquely corpulent. If only these had a longer (7-9 inch) inseam and a wider leg band, I really think my search for the perfect liner would have been over. That said, if you have zero body fat or pin-straight legs, these could be your match…just go up 2 sizes from your street size!

Zoic Essential Liner:
I had high hopes for these given many positive reviews online, but found them unimpressive across the board. The fit was okay, though they are low in front. The chamois was the second densest of the 3 options and seemed like it would be comfortable. The inseam was moderate at around 5-6 inches. The biggest turnoff was the unexpectedly thin fabric that lacked integrity, sort of like a kid’s unlined Lycra swimsuit. There is a band of elastic encased in this material at the top of the yoga-pant-style waist, but it felt strangely rigid in comparison to the thin material. Similarly, the leg band was so much thicker and stronger that the shorts that it created uncomfortable bulging above and below the band. I couldn’t see this fabric standing up well to tugging, heat, sweat, friction, and frequent motion, but if the fit sounds like it could work for your leg shape, it might be worth a look.

Terry Aria Liner: (spoiler: winners!)
Out of the ba, these are the least attractive of the 3 with a high waist, old-school elastic band at the top, perforations all over, and lace bands. You have to pull them on kind of like nylons, by gathering the fabric in your hands, so I was shocked when they slid on like a glove and just felt instantly good everywhere. The chamois is less dense than the other contenders, and I suspect is optimized for road/commuting use, but it’s a quality Italian product with some density over the sit bones and is flexible and breathable. When doing big rides, I haven’t noticed any more soreness than I had in my old, thicker chamois. The shorts slid under my baggies compliantly and don’t slip down or stretch out on the trail. I was concerned the lace bands would be inadequate to hold the legs in place without any silicone grip, but I was wrong. They stay put as well as my old silicone grips plus they’re incredibly comfortable, with no binding or constricted feeling. I’m a fan of the longer inseam. The shorts are very breathable, hold their shape, and hug your curves. They won’t win fashion points but I’m a happy rider!
review.name: Underwhelming

review.reviewBody: Grabbed these to wear under my zoic neveah shorts and I couldn't be happier. Perfect amount of padding and super comfortable, bought a second pair
review.name: Great Chamois Liner

review.reviewBody: These are my daughters first chamois, she loves them. We rode just after getting these in the post and everything was great..fit, function, etc.
review.name: Gift for my daughter

review.reviewBody:
A little on the small side, I'm 5'3" 120# and I got a small. A bit tight and low around the waist, I wish they were a higher rise, and tight around my quads.
Went out on an hour long ride , they were fine, did the job. Not as much padding as I would like for mountain biking, especially on the sits bones. I'll probably just keep these for road biking as they are a little shorter than my other patagonia chamois and better under a 5" short. Overall, fine for what they are, I just prefer more padding and a higher waistband
review.name: Good enough

review.reviewBody: I have two pairs of Zoic's essential liners, one came with the naveah 7 baggie shorts. I wore these liners on every ride last summer, fall and winter. The liner is comfortable and stays in place. I have lost some weight so I need to size down. When I first bought the liners I was 150 lbs, 5'3" and size medium was perfect. I have to agree that I love the wide waistband; it feels more like yoga pants. I am still a newbie and haven't tried many other brands but these beat the heck out of Pearl Izumi's Escape Sugar shorts I bought (also a budget friendly liner but padding is an awful fleecy material).
review.name: comfortable and budget friendly

name: Essential Short Liner - Women's
